title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you for the kind introduction, and thank you to the Housing Assistance Council (HAC) for inviting me to be part of this discussion of rural housing.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I understand that you will shortly be presenting awards to people who are working at the local and national levels and in both the public and private sectors and whose efforts have improved housing conditions for the rural poor.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: All of you who work in these roles are doing your country a great service by helping to advance economic opportunity in our communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I want to thank the award recipients for the difference you make in the lives of people in rural communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I am happy to report that our economy is currently performing very well overall, with strong job creation and gradually rising wages.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The unemployment rate is 3.7 percent, the lowest since 1969.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: A strong job market has encouraged more people to participate in the labor market, another positive development.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: In fact, by many national-level measures, our labor market is very strong.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: As those at this conference are acutely aware, however, aggregate statistics can mask important variations between different demographic and income groups, as well as significant regional differences.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: For example, unemployment rates in some persistently poor rural counties remain much higher than the national figures.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The annual average unemployment rate in 2017 exceeded 10 percent in 27 persistently poor rural counties, and the rate was 20 percent or more in 2 of those counties.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Recent Fed research found that, since 2007, labor force participation rates for those in their prime working years in rural areas have increasingly lagged rates in urban areas.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Labor force participation has been particularly low for those with only a high school diploma or less.1Research has also found that business formation and employment growth during the recovery have been concentrated in large urban areas.2Data and research findings like these remind us that, despite positive trends in national data, the benefits of the ongoing economic expansion are still not reaching some communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Through the Fed's 12 Reserve Banks and their branches, we are able to get a clearer picture of conditions in individual communities across the nation.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Each of the Reserve Banks has an active, well-staffed community development function--one of the great benefits of the Federal Reserve's structure.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We get important and timely information on the state of local economic and financial conditions, including those affecting low- and moderate-income, as well as other underserved, communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Our community development staff provide us with a more nuanced understanding of current economic and financial conditions.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: They also help people in low-income and underserved communities overcome the challenges they face.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We support numerous initiatives in rural communities across the country, several of which I would like to highlight.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The first initiative is the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis's longtime commitment to the Mississippi and Arkansas Delta region.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: This region has struggled for decades with persistent intergenerational poverty and a lack of resources and capacity to address this challenge.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Most recently, in 2016 the St. Louis Fed launched the Delta Communities Initiative, and since then it has held 26 regional forums with more than 500 participants.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: These forums help to build awareness of promising tools and strategies for community and economic development.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: A recent survey of participants suggests that these forums are making a real difference.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: A second example is the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas's commitment to advancing digital inclusion in low-income rural communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Despite significant effort and advances made by public, private, and nonprofit organizations in recent years, nearly 30 percent of rural households continue to lack access to broadband internet service.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Also, fewer than half of households earning less than $20,000 per year have such service.3In an increasingly digital economy, lack of access to high-speed internet and the knowledge of how to make the best use of it limits the ability of families and entire communities to reach their full potential.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: To address this problem, the Dallas Fed has explored the role of the Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) in addressing the digital divide, the potential for technology to bridge the urban-rural divide in access to health care, and the critical importance of preparing workers for the digital economy.4

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Third and last, community development staff at the Federal Reserve Board and several Reserve Banks have conducted research to better understand housing affordability challenges affecting rural communities nationwide, recognizing the importance of sufficient affordable housing to a community's economic vitality.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Researchers found that, as in many urban areas nationwide, a large portion of renters in rural communities struggle to afford their rent‑‑a finding that will not come as a surprise in this room.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Fortunately, our staff also highlighted promising policy and practice solutions that have been implemented in some communities to try to address these challenges, including the establishment of dedicated funding for affordable housing and the elimination of exclusionary land use and zoning policies.5

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: While this type of research and community engagement work is a central component of our efforts to support rural areas, we also know that communities need resources and dedicated local partners to help implement many of the strategies involved.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: CRA has been an important tool for strengthening local community and economic development infrastructure since it was enacted in 1977.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We also recognize that significant changes in the financial services industry since then have hindered the law's effectiveness, especially in rural communities, and that an update of the implementing regulations is appropriate.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: As my colleague Governor Brainard has noted, one of the principles guiding our CRA modernization work is that any redesign of CRA regulations should continue to encourage banks to seek opportunities in underserved areas, including rural communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I understand that the HAC has done considerable research and stakeholder engagement to shed light on the barriers to the effective use of CRA in rural communities; all of that work will benefit our reform efforts.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The Fed's ongoing series of roundtable discussions in communities across the country will also allow us to hear suggestions for improving CRA from local stakeholders, including many people from rural communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: These perspectives will inform our deliberations on this critical regulation, and we will make a summary of our discussions available to the public.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: In closing, while the economy is strong overall, we recognize that some communities have yet to feel the full benefits of the ongoing expansion.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We are conducting research, collaborating with communities, and assessing financial regulations so that our nation's current prosperity will benefit small towns and cities alike.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The work being done by tonight's award recipients and by each of you in this room is critical to making progress toward that goal.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you for being our partners in this work, and enjoy the conference.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: It's an honor to be part of this important occasion.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Tonight is an opportunity to recognize the vital contributions of the Federal Reserve's community development staff, and an opportunity to honor Chair Yellen, who did so much to advance the Fed's community development mission.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Briefly, I would like to focus on the importance of promoting a strong economy that extends opportunity to all and on the role our community development staff plays to advance that goal.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve's mission is to promote a strong economy and sound financial system; I am glad to say we have made a great deal of progress toward those goals.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Unemployment is 3.7 percent, the lowest in nearly half a century.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Over 17 million jobs have been created during this expansion, with an additional 250,000 created in October.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Beyond the labor market, there are other signs of economic strength.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: The steady decline in the unemployment rate is mirrored by the decline in financial hardship reported by respondents to the Federal Reserve's Survey of Household Economics and Decisionmaking over the past five years.1Wage gains, increased household wealth, and elevated consumer confidence are supporting robust consumer spending.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Since the crisis, we have also taken numerous steps to make the financial system safer and stronger, leaving it better equipped to support the financial needs of consumers and communities through good times and bad.2

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: However, the benefits of this strong economy and sound financial system have not reached all Americans.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: The aggregate statistics tend to mask important disparities by income, race, and geography.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Moreover, the economy faces a number of longer-term challenges.3While there have been gains in the pace of wage growth recently, wages for lower-income workers have grown quite slowly over the past few decades.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Productivity has picked up in recent months after several years of very slow growth, but it is not clear whether this is a trend that will be sustained.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: An aging population is limiting growth in labor supply, which in turn limits potential growth.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: And a decades-long decline in economic mobility in the United States reflects the difficulty faced by lower-income Americans in moving up the economic ladder.4

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: The Fed's community development function plays a key role in helping us carry out our broad responsibilities.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Information gathered by the community development staff ensures that the perspectives of individuals and communities inform the Fed's research, policy, and actions.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Soliciting diverse views on issues affecting the economy and financial markets improves the quality of our research, the fairness of our policies, and the transparency of our actions.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Raising awareness of emerging economic trends and risks makes regulation and supervision more responsive to evolving consumer financial services markets and technologies.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: The Fed's community development function also advances our Community Reinvestment Act responsibilities by analyzing and disseminating information related to local financial needs and successful approaches for attracting and deploying capital.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: These efforts strengthen the capacity of both financial institutions and community organizations to meet the needs of the communities they serve.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: In addition to providing us with a richer, more nuanced understanding of current economic and financial conditions, the Federal Reserve's community development staff is deeply engaged in helping lower-income and underserved communities overcome their challenges and capitalize on their assets.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: One thing that was apparent during the recession and the uneven recovery that followed was that people and the places they live are linked.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: When one struggles, both struggle.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Successful community development invests in and builds up both the physical infrastructure and human capital in underserved areas.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve is uniquely positioned to bring together diverse stakeholders to disseminate information, exchange ideas, and identify shared interests that foster local partnerships and comprehensive solutions.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: This event is an opportunity to recognize your efforts to advance solutions that build resilient and more prosperous communities.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: I want to thank Ariel Cisneros--our distinguished inaugural recipient of the Yellen Award for Excellence in Community Development--as well as each of you for your individual and collective service to this effort.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: And speaking of service: It is fitting that this award for excellence in community development will today and thenceforth be given in honor of Janet Yellen.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: During your tenure as Chair, Janet, you elevated the importance of economic and financial inclusion and the Fed's role in community development.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: You reminded us that an inclusive economy is a vibrant economy.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Governor Brainard, the principal oversight governor for community development, and I are honored to carry this message forward.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: The economy benefits when we successfully tap into the underutilized potential of more of our fellow Americans.5

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: Thank you, Janet, for everything that you accomplished as Chair and over a lifetime of public service that thankfully continues today.

title: Celebrating Excellence in Community Development
sentence_text: And congratulations, Ariel, for what you have accomplished in service to others, which has made you such a deserving recipient of this award.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: It is a pleasure to be back at the Economic Club of New York.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: I will begin by briefly reviewing the outlook for the economy, and then turn to a discussion of financial stability.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: My main subject today will be the profound transformation since the Global Financial Crisis in the Federal Reserve's approach to monitoring and addressing financial stability.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Today marks the publication of the Board of Governors' firstFinancial Stability Report.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Earlier this month, we published our firstSupervision and Regulation Report.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Together, these reports contain a wealth of information on our approach to financial stability and to financial regulation more broadly.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: By clearly and transparently explaining our policies, we aim to strengthen the foundation of democratic legitimacy that enables the Fed to serve the needs of the American public.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Outlook and Monetary PolicyCongress assigned the Federal Reserve the job of promoting maximum employment and price stability.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: I am pleased to say that our economy is now close to both of those objectives.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The unemployment rate is 3.7 percent, a 49-year low, and many other measures of labor market strength are at or near historic bests.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Inflation is near our 2 percent target.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The economy is growing at an annual rate of about 3 percent, well above most estimates of its longer-run trend.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: For seven years during the crisis and its painful aftermath, the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) kept our policy interest rate unprecedentedly low--in fact, near zero--to support the economy as it struggled to recover.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The health of the economy gradually but steadily improved, and about three years ago the FOMC judged that the interests of households and businesses, of savers and borrowers, were no longer best served by such extraordinarily low rates.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We therefore began to raise our policy rate gradually toward levels that are more normal in a healthy economy.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Interest rates are still low by historical standards, and they remain just below the broad range of estimates of the level that would be neutral for the economy‑‑that is, neither speeding up nor slowing down growth.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: My FOMC colleagues and I, as well as many private-sector economists, are forecasting continued solid growth, low unemployment, and inflation near 2 percent.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: There is a great deal to like about this outlook.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: But we know that things often turn out to be quite different from even the most careful forecasts.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: For this reason, sound policymaking is as much about managing risks as it is about responding to the baseline forecast.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Our gradual pace of raising interest rates has been an exercise in balancing risks.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We know that moving too fast would risk shortening the expansion.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We also know that moving too slowly--keeping interest rates too low for too long--could risk other distortions in the form of higher inflation or destabilizing financial imbalances.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Our path of gradual increases has been designed to balance these two risks, both of which we must take seriously.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We also know that the economic effects of our gradual rate increases are uncertain, and may take a year or more to be fully realized.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: While FOMC participants' projections are based on our best assessments of the outlook, there is no preset policy path.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We will be paying very close attention to what incoming economic and financial data are telling us.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: As always, our decisions on monetary policy will be designed to keep the economy on track in light of the changing outlook for jobs and inflation.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Under the dual mandate, jobs and inflation are the Fed's meat and potatoes.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In the rest of my comments, I will focus on financial stability--a topic that has always been on the menu, but that, since the crisis, has become a more integral part of the meal.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Historical Perspective on Financial StabilityThe term "financial stability" has a particular meaning in this context.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: A stable financial system is one that continues to function effectively even in severely adverse conditions.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: A stable system meets the borrowing and investment needs of households and businesses despite economic turbulence.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: An unstable system, in contrast, may amplify turbulence and prolong economic hardship in the face of stress by failing to provide these essential services when they are needed most.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: For Economic Club of New York trivia buffs, I will note that the second ever presentation to this club by a Federal Reserve official was about this very topic.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The date was March 18, 1929.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Weeks before, the Fed had issued a public statement of concern over stock market speculation, and had provided guidance frowning on bank funding of such speculation.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: William Harding, a former Fed Chair and then president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston, defended the Fed's actions in his talk.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: He argued that, while the Fed should not act as the arbiter of correct asset prices, it did have a primary responsibility to protect the banking system's capacity to meet the credit needs of households and businesses.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: At the meeting, critics argued that public statements about inflated asset prices were "fraught with danger;" that the nation's banks were so well managed that they should not "face public admonition"; and, more generally, that the Fed was "out of its sphere.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: "1Of course, Harding spoke just a few months before the 1929 stock market crash, which signaled the onset of the Great Depression.2

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Fast forwarding, a host of Depression-era reforms helped avoid, for the next three-quarters of a century, a systemic financial crisis and the associated severe economic dislocation‑‑the longest such period in American history.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Those decades saw many advances in monetary policy and in bank regulatory policy, but the appropriate role for government in managing threats to the broader financial system remained unresolved.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Periodic bouts of financial stress during this period--such as the Latin American debt crisis, the savings and loan crisis, and the Russian debt default--were met with improvised responses.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Policymakers conjured fixes from a mixture of private-sector rescues, emergency liquidity, occasional implicit or explicit bailouts, and monetary accommodation.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Outside of these crisis responses, however, systemic issues were not a central focus of policy.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The Global Financial Crisis demonstrated, in the clearest way, the limits of this approach.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Highly inventive and courageous improvisation amid scenes of great drama helped avoid another Great Depression, but failed to prevent the most severe recession in 75 years.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The crisis made clear that there can be no macroeconomic stability without financial stability, and that systemic stability risks often take root and blossom in good times.3Thus, as the emergency phase of the crisis subsided, Congress, the Fed, and the other financial regulators began developing a fundamentally different approach to financial stability.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Instead of relying on improvised responses after crises strike, policymakers now constantly monitor vulnerabilities and require firms to plan in advance for financial distress, in a framework that lays out solutions in advance during good times.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The New Approach to Financial StabilityThis new approach can be divided into three parts.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: First, build up the strength and resilience of the financial system.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Second, develop and apply a broad framework for monitoring financial stability on an ongoing basis.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: And third, explain the new approach as transparently as possible, so that the public and its representatives in Congress can provide oversight and hold us accountable for this work.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Although I'll focus mainly on the stability efforts of the Federal Reserve, a number of federal regulatory agencies have responsibilities in this area.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: All of these agencies are represented on the Financial Stability Oversight Council, or FSOC, which is chaired by the Treasury Secretary and which provides a forum for interagency cooperation in responding to emerging risks.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Building Resilience of the Financial SystemAfter 10 years of concentrated effort in the public and private sectors, the system is now much stronger, with greater capacity to function effectively in stressful times.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In the banking system, we have implemented a post-crisis regulatory framework based on robust capital and liquidity requirements, a strong stress-testing regime, and mandatory living wills for the largest firms.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: As a result, banks now have much more high quality capital than before (figure 1).

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The most recent stress tests indicate that, even after a severe global recession, capital levels at the largest banks would remain above regulatory minimums, and above the levels those banks held in good times before the crisis.4The most systemically important financial institutions also now hold roughly 20 percent of their assets in the form of high quality liquid assets--that is, safe assets that could be readily sold at short notice (figure 2).

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The share of these assets is about four times its pre-crisis level.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Compared with other economies, lending and borrowing in the United States depend less on bank loans and more on funds flowing through a wide array of capital market channels.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The crisis revealed that this capital market centric system, despite its many benefits, also provides more places where systemic risks can emerge.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In response, Congress and the regulatory agencies have made many stability-enhancing changes outside of the banking system.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: For example, many derivatives transactions are now required to be centrally cleared, which, through netting, has reduced exposures and enabled better management of counterparty risk.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Tri-party repurchase agreement (repo) reforms have substantially improved the resilience of that marketplace, in particular by limiting intraday loans.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Before the crisis, prime institutional money market funds were permitted to report a constant, $1 share price so long as the value of the underlying assets remained near $1.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: This reporting convention, combined with the implicit support of the plans' sponsors, led investors to treat those funds like bank deposits, even though they were not likewise insured.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: These funds are now required to report floating net-asset values, and after this reform investors chose to migrate to government-only funds, which are safer and less susceptible to runs (figure 3).5These and other measures have reduced the risk that key non-bank parts of the system would freeze up in the face of market stress.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: A New Framework for Monitoring Systemic RisksInnovation and risk-taking contribute to the dynamism of our financial system and our economy.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: As Hyman Minsky emphasized, along with the many benefits of dynamism comes the reality that the financial system will sometimes evolve toward excess and dangerous imbalances.6This reality underscores the vital importance of the second part of post-crisis reform: monitoring for emerging vulnerabilities.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: As laid out in our newFinancial Stability Report, we have developed a framework to help us monitor risks to stability in our complex and rapidly evolving financial system.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The framework distinguishes between shocks, that is, trigger events that can be hard to predict or influence, and vulnerabilities, defined as features of the financial system that amplify shocks.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The report is organized around four broad vulnerabilities that have been prominent in financial crises through the centuries.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Each of these vulnerabilities is often found to some degree even in healthy market-based systems, and there is not, at present, any generally accepted standard for assessing at what level the vulnerabilities begin to pose serious stability risks.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In lieu of such a standard, we flag cases in which the vulnerabilities rise well beyond historical norms, and then form judgments about the stability risks those cases present.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The first vulnerability is excessive leverage in the financial sector.7If a highly leveraged segment of the financial system is buffeted by adverse events, the affected entities may all need to deleverage at the same time by selling assets, leading to what is called a "fire sale."

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Both the resulting decline in asset prices and the impaired ability of the segment to play its role in the economy can amplify the effects of a downturn.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We saw this chain of events play out repeatedly in various parts of the financial sector in the weeks following the failure of Lehman Brothers in 2008.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In our surveillance, we examine leverage across many types of financial institutions, including banks, insurance companies, hedge funds, and various funding vehicles.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Currently, we do not detect a broad-based buildup of abnormal or excessive leverage.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: As with banks, capital levels at insurance companies and broker-dealers appear robust.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In addition, securitization levels are far below their pre-crisis levels, and those structures that do exist rely on more stable funding (seefigure 4).

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Our view into leverage and risk-taking outside the banking sector is admittedly incomplete, however, and we are always working to get a better view of emerging leverage excesses.8

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The second vulnerability is funding risk, which arises when banks or nonbank financial entities rely on funding that can be rapidly withdrawn.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: If depositors or market participants lose faith in the soundness of an institution or the system as a whole, unstable funding can simply vanish in what is called a "run."

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: During the crisis, we saw widespread runs, including at broker-dealers, some segments of the repo market, and money market mutual funds.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: These runs did severe damage, contributing to a generalized panic at the time.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Had the authorities not stepped in, the damage could have been even more severe.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Today we view funding-risk vulnerabilities as low.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Banks hold low levels of liabilities that are able and likely to run, and they hold high levels of liquid assets to fund any outflows that do occur.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Money market mutual fund reforms have greatly reduced the run risk in that sector.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: More generally, it is short-term, uninsured funding that would be most likely to run in a future stress event, and the volume of such funding is now significantly below pre-crisis peaks.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Taken together, the evidence on these first two vulnerabilities strongly supports the view that financial institutions and markets are substantially more resilient than they were before the crisis.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Indeed, the American financial system has successfully weathered some periods of significant stress over the past several years.9

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The third vulnerability is excessive debt loads at households and businesses.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Credit booms have often led to credit busts and sometimes to painful economic downturns.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: When the bust comes, those who have overborrowed tend to sharply reduce their spending.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Defaults typically rise faster than had been expected, which may put financial institutions into distress.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: These effects may combine to bring a serious economic downturn.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: This boom-bust pattern was clear in measures of household debt around the crisis period, with mortgage debt rising far above its historical trend and then contracting sharply (seefigure 5).

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: After the contraction, household debt has grown only moderately.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The net increase in mortgage debt has been among borrowers with higher credit scores.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: While heavily indebted households always suffer in a downturn, all of this suggests that household debt would not present a systemic stability threat if the economy sours.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Nonfinancial business borrowing presents a subtler story.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: With corporate debt, the United States has not faced a massive credit boom like that experienced with residential mortgages before the recent crisis.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Instead, after controlling for its trend, business borrowing relative GDP has risen during expansions, no doubt reflecting business optimism, and then fallen when the cycle turned, as some of that optimism proved unfounded (seefigure 6).

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: By this measure, the ratio of corporate debt to GDP is about where one might expect after nearly a decade of economic expansion: it is well above its trend, but not yet at the peaks hit in the late 1980s or late 1990s.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Further, the upward trend in recent years appears broadly consistent with the growth in business assets relative to GDP.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: There are reasons for concern, however.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Information on individual firms reveals that, over the past year, firms with high leverage and interest burdens have been increasing their debt loads the most (seefigure 7).

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In addition, other measures of underwriting quality have deteriorated, and leverage multiples have moved up.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Some of these highly leveraged borrowers would surely face distress if the economy turned down, leading investors to take higher-than-expected losses--developments that could exacerbate the downturn.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The question for financial stability is whether elevated business bankruptcies and outsized losses would risk undermining the ability of the financial system to perform its critical functions on behalf of households and businesses.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: For now, my view is that such losses are unlikely to pose a threat to the safety and soundness of the institutions at the core of the system and, instead, are likely to fall on investors in vehicles like collateralized loan obligations with stable funding that present little threat of damaging fire sales.10Of course, we will continue to monitor developments in this sector carefully.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The fourth and final vulnerability arises when asset values rise far above conventional, historically observed valuation benchmarks--a phenomenon popularly referred to as a "bubble."

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The contentious term "bubble" does not appear in our work, however.11Instead, we focus is on the extent to which an asset's price is high or low relative to conventional benchmarks based on expected payoffs and current economic conditions.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Historically, when asset prices soar far above standard benchmarks, sharp declines follow with some regularity, and those declines may bring economic misery reaching far beyond investors directly involved in the speculative boom.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We therefore pay close attention when valuations get to the extreme ends of what we have seen in history.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Looking across the landscape of major asset classes, we see some classes for which valuations seem high relative to history.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: For example, even after standard adjustments for economic conditions, valuations on riskier forms of corporate debt and commercial properties are in the upper ends of their post-crisis distributions, although they are short of the levels they hit in the pre-crisis credit boom.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We see no major asset class, however, where valuations appear far in excess of standard benchmarks as some did, for example, in the late 1990s dot-com boom or the pre-crisis credit boom.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The asset class that gets the most attention day-to-day is, of course, the stock market.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Today, equity market prices are broadly consistent with historical benchmarks such as forward price-to-earnings ratios (seefigure 8).

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: It is important to distinguish between market volatility and events that threaten financial stability.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Large, sustained declines in equity prices can put downward pressure on spending and confidence.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: From the financial stability perspective, however, today we do not see dangerous excesses in the stock market.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Monitoring Likely Triggers for Financial DistressI mentioned the distinction between vulnerabilities and shocks, or triggers.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In addition to monitoring vulnerabilities under our four-part framework, we also consult a broad range of contacts regarding sources of risk that might trigger distress at any given time.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: For example, discussions with contacts currently point to risks emanating from the normalization of monetary policy in the United States and elsewhere, the unsettled state of trade negotiations, Brexit negotiations, budget discussions between Italy and the European Union, and cyber-related disruptions.12

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Having identified possible triggers, we can assess how a particular trigger is likely to interact with known vulnerabilities.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: A good current example is that of Brexit.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: U.S. banks and broker-dealers participate in some of the markets most likely to be affected by Brexit.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The Fed and other regulators have been working with U.S. financial institutions that have operations in the European Union or the United Kingdom to prepare for the full range of possible outcomes to the negotiations.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In addition, the scenarios used in the stress tests routinely feature severe global contractions and show that U.S. banks have the capital to weather even highly disruptive events.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Bottom Line: Financial Stability Risks Are ModerateI have reviewed a few of the key facts that inform our thinking about financial stability, and you will find a great deal more detail in our new report.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: You will also find that the report does not come to a bottom line conclusion.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: As I noted earlier, we have limited experience with this monitoring, and there is no widely accepted basis for reaching a bottom line.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Thus, the purpose of the report is to provide a common platform and set of readings from which policymakers and other interested parties can form their own views.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Individual policymakers will sometimes differ in their assessments and on the relative weight they put on particular vulnerabilities.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: My own assessment is that, while risks are above normal in some areas and below normal in others, overall financial stability vulnerabilities are at a moderate level.13

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: In my view, the most important feature of the stability landscape is the strength of the financial system.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The risks of destabilizing runs are far lower than in the past.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The institutions at the heart of the financial system are more resilient.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: The stress tests routinely feature extremely severe downturns in business credit, and the largest banks have the capital and liquidity to continue to function under such circumstances.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Because this core resilience is so important, we are committed to preserving and strengthening the key improvements since the crisis, particularly those in capital, liquidity, stress testing, and resolution.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: ConclusionI'd like to conclude by putting financial stability and our two new reports in a longer-term context.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: To paraphrase a famous line, "eternal vigilance is the price of financial stability."

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We will publish these reports regularly as part of our vigilance.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Over time, some may be tempted to dismiss the reports entirely or to overdramatize any concerns they raise.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Instead, these reports should be viewed as you might view the results of a regular health checkup.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We all hope for a report that is not very exciting.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: Many baby boomers like me are, however, reaching an age where a good report is, "Well, there are a number of things we should keep an eye on, but all things considered you are in good health."

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: That is how I view theFinancial Stability Reportout today.

title: The Federal Reserve's Framework for Monitoring Financial Stability
sentence_text: We hope that this report and theSupervision and Regulation Reportwill be important tools, sharing Federal Reserve views and stimulating public dialogue regarding the stability of the financial system.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: It is a pleasure and an honor to speak here today at the 60th Annual Meeting of the National Association for Business Economics (NABE).

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Since 1959, NABE has promoted the use of economics in the workplace and advanced the worthy purpose of ensuring that leading American businesses benefit from the insights of economists.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Today I will focus on the Federal Reserve's ongoing efforts to promote maximum employment and stable prices.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: I am pleased to say that, by these measures, the economy looks very good.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The unemployment rate stands at 3.9 percent, near a 20-year low.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Inflation is currently running near the Federal Open Market Committee's (FOMC) objective of 2 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: While these two top-line statistics do not always present an accurate picture of overall economic conditions, a wide range of data on jobs and prices supports a positive view.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: In addition, many forecasters are predicting that these favorable conditions are likely to continue.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: For example, the medians of the most recent projections from FOMC participants and the Survey of Professional Forecasters, as well as the most recent Congressional Budget Office (CBO) forecast, all have the unemployment rate remaining below 4 percent through the end of 2020, with inflation staying very near 2 percent over the same period.1

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: From the standpoint of our dual mandate, this is a remarkably positive outlook.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Indeed, I was asked at last week's press conference whether these forecasts are too good to be true--a reasonable question!

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Since 1950, the U.S. economy has experienced periods of low, stable inflation and periods of very low unemployment, but never both for such an extended time as is seen in these forecasts.2Standard economic thinking has long offered an explanation for this: If unemployment were to remain this low for this long, employers would be pushing up wages as they compete for scarce workers, and rising labor costs would feed into more‑rapid price inflation faced by consumers.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: This dynamic between unemployment and inflation is known as a Phillips curve relationship, and at times it can pose a fundamental tension between the two sides of the Fed's mandate to promote maximum employment and price stability.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Recent low inflation and unemployment have some analysts asking, "Is the Phillips curve dead?

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: "3Others argue that the Phillips curve still lurks in the background and could reemerge at any time to exact revenge for low unemployment in the form of high inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: My comments today have two main objectives.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The first is to explain how changes in the Phillips curve help account for the somewhat surprising but broadly shared current forecasts of continued very low unemployment with inflation near 2 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: At the risk of spoiling the surprise, I do not see it as likely that the Phillips curve is dead, or that it will soon exact revenge.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: What is more likely, in my view, is that many factors, including better conduct of monetary policy over the past few decades, have greatly reduced, but not eliminated, the effects that tight labor markets have on inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: However, no one fully understands the nature of these changes or the role they play in the current context.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Common sense suggests we should beware when forecasts predict events seldom before observed in the economy.4

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Thus, my second objective today is to explain, given this uncertainty about the unemployment-inflation relationship, the important role that risk management plays in setting monetary policy.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: I will explore the FOMC's monitoring and balancing of risks as well as our contingency planning for cases when risk becomes reality.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Historical Perspective on Jobs and InflationLet us start with a look at the modern history of jobs and inflation in the United States.Figure 1shows headline inflation and unemployment from 1960 to today and extended through 2020 using the average of median projections from both FOMC participants and the Survey of Professional Forecasters, and the CBO projections.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: As the figure makes clear, a multiyear period with unemployment below 4 percent and stable inflation would, if realized, be unique in modern U.S. data.5

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: To understand the basis for these forecasts, it is useful to contrast two very different periods included in figure 1: From 1960 to 1985, and the period from 1995 to today.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The first period includes the Great Inflation, and the latter includes both the Great Moderation and the distinctly immoderate period of the Global Financial Crisis and its aftermath.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Figure 2shows unemployment and core, rather than headline, inflation in these two periods.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: While our inflation objective concerns headline inflation, switching to core inflation makes some relationships clearer by removing a good deal of variability due to food and energy prices, variability that is not primarily driven by labor market conditions or monetary policy.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: There is a dramatic difference in the unemployment-inflation relationship across these two periods.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: During the Great Inflation, unemployment fluctuated between roughly 4 percent and 10 percent, and inflation moved over a similar range.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: In the recent period, the unemployment rate also fluctuated between roughly 4 percent and 10 percent, but inflation has been relatively tame, averaging 1.7 percent and never declining below 1 percent or rising to 2.5 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Even during the financial crisis, core inflation barely budged.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: As a thought experiment, look at the right panel and imagine that you could see only the red line (inflation), and not the blue line (unemployment).

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Nothing in the red line hints at a major economic event, let alone the immense upheaval around the time of the global financial crisis.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Notice that, in each period, there is only one episode in which unemployment drops below 4 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: In the late 1960s, unemployment remained at or below 4 percent for four years, and during that time inflation rose steadily from under 2 percent to almost 5 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: By contrast, the late 1990s episode of below-4-percent unemployment was quite brief, and during the episode and surrounding quarters inflation was reasonably stable and remained below 2 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: To explore the Phillips curve relationship in these two periods more closely, we need to bring in the concept of the natural rate of unemployment.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: In standard economic thinking, an unemployment rate above the natural rate indicates slack in the labor market and tends to be associated with downward pressure on inflation; unemployment below the natural rate represents a tight labor market and is associated with upward inflation pressure.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Figure 3repeats figure 2 but replaces unemployment with labor market slack as measured by unemployment minus the CBO's current estimate of the natural rate of unemployment at each point in time.6Periods of tight labor markets are shaded.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: During the Great Inflation, inflation generally rose in the tight, shaded periods and fell in the unshaded ones, just as conventional Phillips curve reasoning predicts.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: From 1995 to today, the large and persistent swings in the gap between unemployment and the natural rate were associated with, at most, a move of a few tenths in the inflation rate.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Comparing the shaded and unshaded regions, you might see some association between slack and the minor ups and downs in inflation, but the pattern is not at all consistent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: It is evidence like this that fuels speculation about the Phillips curve's demise.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Whether dead, sick, or merely resting, many of the questions about the Phillips curve come down to figuring out what changed between these two periods, and why.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Let us turn to a conceptual framework for examining these questions more systematically.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: A Simple Framework for Understanding Changes in the Jobs-Inflation RelationshipA natural starting point is the simplest form of a Phillips curve equation, which posits that inflation this year is determined by some combination of current labor market slack, inflation last year, and some other factors that I will leave aside for this discussion (figure 4):7

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The value ofBis often referred to as the slope of the Phillips curve.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: With a larger value ofB,any change in labor market slack translates into a bigger change in inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: As we say, asBincreases, the Phillips curve steepens.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The value ofCdetermines inflation's persistence--that is, how long any given change in inflation tends to linger.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: As the value ofCincreases, higher inflation this year translates more into higher inflation next year.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: A particularly nasty case arises whenBandCare both large.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: In this case, slack has a large effect on inflation, and that effect tends to be very persistent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: One implication of a largeCis that, if a boom drives inflation up, it will tend to stay up unless offset by a subsequent bust.8

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Figure 5shows regression estimates ofBandC,computed over 20-year samples starting with the sample from 1965 to 1984 and including each 20-year sample through 2017.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: During the Great Inflation samples, the value ofCis near 1, meaning that higher inflation one year tended to translate almost one-for-one into higher inflation the next.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The Phillips curve is also relatively steep in the Great Inflation samples, with 1 extra percentage point of lower unemployment converting into roughly 1/2 percentage point of higher inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Thus, the Great Inflation presented that nasty case just described.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The estimates of bothBandCfall in value as the estimation sample shifts forward in time.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: In the most recent samples, the Phillips curve is nearly flat, withBvery near zero, andCis about 0.25, meaning that roughly one fourth of any rise or fall in inflation carries forward.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: These results give numerical form to what we see in the right-hand panel of figure 3, covering the recent period: Large and persistent moves in the unemployment gap were associated with, at most, modest transitory moves in inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: What Led to the Changes in the Phillips curve?These developments amount to a better world for households and businesses, which no longer experience or even fear the scourge of high and volatile inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: To provide a sound basis for monetary policy, it is important to understand what happened and why, so we can avoid a return to the bad old days of the 1970s.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Like many, I believe better monetary policy has played a central role.9

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: To understand the mechanism, let us ask how central banks could, presumably inadvertently, amplify and extend the duration of inflation's response to labor market tightness.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: To do so, the central bank could persistentlyeasethe stance of monetary policy in response to an uptick in inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: No responsible central banker today would intentionally do this, but much research suggests that during the Great Inflation, misunderstandings about how the economy worked led the Fed effectively to behave in this manner.10Some policymakers may have believed the misguided notion that accommodating permanently higher inflation could purchase permanently higher employment.11Other policymakers misperceived the level of the natural rate of unemployment, which we now believe had shifted up markedly in the 1960s.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: With the higher natural rate, the labor market was much tighter and provided much greater upward pressure on inflation than policymakers realized in real time.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: As a result, they were continually "behind the curve.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The channel through which monetary policy can amplify and extend inflation's response to shocks becomes even stronger when we take account of expectations.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: If people come to expect that upward blips in inflation will result in ongoing higher inflation, they will build that view into wage and price decisions.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: In this case, people's expectations become a force adding momentum to inflation, and breaking inflation's momentum can require convincing people to change their minds and behavior--never an easy task.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Arguably, this is why a federal funds rate near 20 percent--roughly 10 percent in real terms‑‑was required in the early 1980s to turn the tide on high inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The cost, in the form of very high unemployment, is clear in the Great Inflation figures.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The Great Inflation taught us that a main task of monetary policy is to keep inflation expectations anchored at some low level.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: This idea is behind the adoption in recent decades of inflation targets, such as the Fed's 2 percent objective, by central banks around the world.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: When monetary policy tends to offset shocks to inflation, rather than amplifying and extending them, and when people come to expect this policy response, a surprise rise or fall in labor market tightness will naturally have smaller and less persistent effects on inflation.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Research suggests that this reasoning can account for a good deal of the change in the Phillips curve relationship.13It is also likely that many other factors have contributed to changes in inflation dynamics over recent decades.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: We do not fully understand the causes and implications of these changes, which raises risk management issues that I will take up now.14

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: A Favorable Outlook, but What Could Go Wrong?To set the stage, let us return to the situation facing the FOMC.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The baseline forecasts of most FOMC participants and a broad range of others show unemployment remaining below 4 percent for an extended period, with inflation steady near 2 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: I have made the case that this forecast is not too good to be true and does not signal the death of the Phillips curve.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Instead, the outlook is consistent with evidence of a very flat Phillips curve and inflation expectations anchored near 2 percent.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: But we still must face the cautionary advice to beware when forecasts point to rarely seen outcomes.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: As a way of heeding this advice, the Committee takes a risk management approach, which has three important parts: monitoring risks; balancing risks, both upside and downside; and contingency planning for surprises.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Let me describe a few of the risks and how we are thinking about them.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Could Inflation Expectations Become Unanchored?First is the risk that inflation expectations might lose their anchor.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: We attribute a great deal of the stability of inflation in recent years to the anchoring of longer-term inflation expectations.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: And we are aware that it could be very costly if those expectations were to drift materially.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: As you probably know from our public communications, we carefully monitor survey- and market-based proxies for expectations, and we do not see evidence of a material shift in longer-term expectations (figure 6).

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The survey measures have been particularly steady for some time.15The financial market-based measures include both an expectations component and a volatile inflation premium component, so they tend to move around much more than the surveys, but we see no evidence of a material change in these measures, either.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: The risks to inflation expectations are, of course, two sided.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Until this summer, inflation had remained stubbornly below 2 percent for several years.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: And major economies in much of the world have been struggling mainly with disinflationary forces.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Thus, we have been and will remain alert for possible downward drift in expectations.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: Some argue the contrary case--that by only gradually removing accommodation as the unemployment rate has fallen, the FOMC may have fallen behind the curve, thereby risking an upward drift in expectations.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
sentence_text: From the standpoint of contingency planning, our course is clear: Resolutely conduct policy consistent with the FOMC's symmetric 2 percent inflation objective, and stand ready to act with authority if expectations drift materially up or down.

title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
