sentence_text: Birth rates have edged down, and immigration has slowed.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Not only is the total population growing more slowly, but the share of the population in their prime working years is falling steadily as the very large baby-boom generation is moving into retirement.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Demographic factors are generally slow moving and predictable, and there is no surprise in the fact that slower population growth and the retirement of the baby boomers are now contributing to slower growth in the total amount of work performed in the economy.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: There is another factor contributing to the slower growth in hours, however, and this factor is more surprising and more troubling.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: To be counted as "in the labor force," a person must either be employed or have looked for work within the past four weeks.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The share of people of working age who are actually in the labor force has fallen significantly since the late 1990s.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: This decline raises the important question of why have people of working age increasingly chosen not to work.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The data suggest that there are both positive and more problematic forces at work.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: For example, among those aged 16 to 24, participation in the labor market has fallen from about 65 percent in the 1990s to 55 percent now (figure 6).

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: But this drop in participation appears to reflect young people getting more education.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The fraction of this age group who are neither in school nor in the labor force has held fairly constant at around 11 percent, and measures of school enrollment are up.5Higher educational attainment is much more important in today's job market than in the past, and investing in education today has long-term benefits for both the student and for society.6Statistics confirm that higher educational attainment is associated with higher labor force participation, lower unemployment, and higher wages.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Turning to those aged 25 to 54, the participation picture is more troubling.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Among prime-age men, participation has been falling for more than 60 years, with the decline averaging about 1.5 percentage points per decade (figure 7).

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: For women, participation rose over the second half of the 20th century until peaking in the late 1990s.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Since then, women's participation has dropped just a bit.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: To put these numbers in context, let's look at data from other advanced economies.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Prime-age male participation has fallen some across most of these economies since 1995 (figure 8).

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: But the decline in the United States has been much larger than most, and U.S. participation was below the middle of the pack at the outset.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: As a result, the United States now has the fourth lowest participation rate among 34 advanced economies.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: For women's participation, the details are different, but the bottom line is similar.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: In the mid-1990s, the United States ranked in the upper tier for prime-age women's participation, but since then participation by women has advanced rapidly in many countries while it has declined slightly in the United States.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Now the United States is sixth lowest among these 34 countries.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Researchers have investigated numerous possible reasons for the decline in prime-age participation.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Among men, the drop in participation is much sharper for those with only a high school education or less.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The drop for women is also sharper for those who are high school educated.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: This pattern is consistent with the idea that a modern economy demands ever-higher skills, and that workers without those skills are being left behind (figure 9).

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: But the international experience suggests that this outcome is not inevitable: The drop in participation among those with less education is much smaller in some comparable countries than in the United States.7

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The research into labor force participation in the United States and across the world does not find a magic fix, but it does suggest a variety of policies that might better prepare people for the modern workforce as well as support and reward labor force participation.8I should note that the Fed has neither the tools nor the mandate to directly address the forces that are holding back labor force participation.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: We can contribute by fostering a strong labor market, in accordance with our mandate.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: While it is not the Fed's role to advocate particular labor force policies, I do want to put a spotlight on this important issue.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: I strongly believe policies that bring prime-age workers into productive employment, particularly those who may have been left behind because of low skills or educational attainment, could bring great benefits both to those workers and to our economy.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The second factor accounting for the slowdown in GDP growth is the slower pace of labor productivity growth, or output per hour worked.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: When measured annually, labor productivity growth is volatile, but focusing on five-year averages, we can see that from 1975 through 2007, productivity growth averaged about 2 percent while fluctuating between about 1 and 4 percent (figure 10).

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Since then, growth seems to have settled at the low end of that historical range.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Unlike the situation with labor force participation, the slowdown in productivity growth is also evident in most advanced economies, and the U.S. experience is roughly comparable to that of other countries.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: There is an ongoing debate over the causes and implications of this global slowdown in productivity growth.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Some argue that the rapid growth seen over much of the 20th century was historically anomalous, and that we are destined to return to the slower growth of centuries past.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Others are more optimistic that strong growth can return.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Many have noted that during the current expansion, investment and capital accumulation have been lower than in previous expansions, so perhaps we just need to invest more.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Unfortunately, it does not seem to be that simple.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Standard reasoning holds that capital-per-worker drives productivity.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: While we have had slower capital accumulation of late, we have also had slower growth in labor supply--hours worked.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Thus, capital per worker, according to some analysis, has continued to increase roughly at its pre-recession trend.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: In this view, the productivity problem is not simply one of inadequate investment.9

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Researchers have proposed several reasons why, even if the quantity of investment has kept up, recent investment may be leading to smaller productivity advances than in the past.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The more optimistic analysts argue that we may be in a productivity lull while businesses work to realize the full benefit of advances that are embedded in recent investment.10Others suggest that productivity-advancing ideas are inherently harder to find and exploit than in the past, implying that slower productivity growth may be with us for the long haul.11This debate is unlikely to be resolved anytime soon.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: In the meantime, we should look for policies that will create an environment in which productivity can flourish.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: We need policies that support innovation and create a favorable environment for investment in both the skills of workers and the tools they have.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Indeed, the recent tax reforms were designed in part to boost capital investment and thus productivity.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Once again, my goal tonight is to highlight the importance of growth-enhancing policies.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Because these policies are not the province of the Fed, I will not advocate for particular approaches.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Instead, I will just observe that researchers and policy analysts have proposed many promising ideas that may be capable of attracting wide support.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Policies that succeed in enhancing productivity growth would greatly benefit future generations of Americans.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: ConclusionTo conclude, the United States is currently in the midst of one of the longest economic expansions in our history.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Unemployment is low and inflation is close to our 2 percent objective.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: My colleagues and I on the FOMC are focused on using our monetary policy tools to sustain those favorable conditions.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: Tonight I have also highlighted some longer-term challenges we face, including low labor force participation by prime-age workers and low productivity growth.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: By promoting macroeconomic stability, the Fed helps create a healthy environment for growth.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: But these longer-term issues require policies that are more in the province of elected representatives.

title: Recent Economic Developments and Longer-Term Challenges
sentence_text: The nation would benefit greatly from a search for policies with broad appeal that could promote labor force participation and higher productivity, with benefits shared broadly across the nation.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Thank you for that kind introduction.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: I also want to thank Hope Enterprise Corporation for inviting me to speak and Mississippi Valley State University (MVSU) for hosting us on its lovely campus.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: It is a great pleasure to visit the Mississippi Delta.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: This region gave America the priceless musical heritage of the Blues.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: It was also the site of some of the watershed events of the civil rights movement.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: But the Delta, like many rural areas, has long confronted the challenge of poverty.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Today I'll speak about three areas of opportunity for addressing the challenges of rural poverty‑‑education and workforce development, entrepreneurship and small business development, as well as access to financial services--the topic of this conference.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: MVSU's mission, providing young people an affordable college education, is itself a very powerful antipoverty program‑‑for its graduates, of course, but also for other communities that are touched by the university.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: MVSU opened its doors in 1950 as Mississippi Vocational College.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: The vocation of every member of its first class of 200 students was teaching.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: And even as it added other programs and became a full-fledged university, MVSU has continued to train many of the teachers who enrich, inspire, and spark the imagination of children who grow up in the Delta.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: MVSU and other historically black colleges and universities, or HBCUs, play a crucial role in their communities.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: For much of the 20th century, HBCUs were the primary means for black men and women to obtain the education needed for middle class or professional jobs.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Larger percentages of HBCU students, compared with students at predominantly white institutions, come from lower-income families and are the first in their families to attend college.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: This university and other HBCUs support intellectual leadership, creativity, and innovation.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: I want to honor you for this proud history and for your continuing commitment to a better future for your students and for the region where many of your students were born and will build their lives and raise their families.1

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Challenges and Opportunities in Poor Rural CommunitiesToday, data at the national level show a strong economy.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Unemployment is near a half-century low, and economic output is growing at a solid pace.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: But we know that prosperity has not been felt as much in some areas, including many rural places.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve can help by carrying out our monetary policy mission of supporting maximum employment and price stability.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: We also support strong communities by conducting research, promoting community development, and enforcing laws like the Community Reinvestment Act, which helps ensure that people have adequate access to financial services wherever they live.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: We not only work with communities, we are in communities, through the presence of our 12 regional Reserve Banks.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Poverty remains a challenge in many rural communities.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Indeed, 70 percent of the 473 "persistent poverty" counties in the United States are rural.2Unemployment and mortality rates remain high in these communities.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Along with lower incomes and wealth, the rate of business start-ups in these areas is lower.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: And their residents have less access to financial services.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Many of these disparities have existed for generations, and in some places have roots in a history of discrimination.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: These areas also generally lack diverse industries and employment options and often have suffered from a decline in a traditional industry.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: In Appalachia for instance, timber, coal mining, tobacco, and textiles have long been in decline.3Likewise, the number of jobs in agriculture and low-skilled manufacturing, mainstays of the Delta's economy, is decreasing as a result of automation and outsourcing.4

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Education and Workforce DevelopmentHigh-quality education and training play a crucial role in extending opportunity in rural areas, starting with early childhood education.5But in many rural communities, access to high-quality preschool education is limited.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Mississippi is one of several mostly rural states where nearly half of residents lack access to good quality childcare, which is the main source of early childhood education.6Many decades of research also confirm that children who grow up in areas with better-quality K-12 schools or in classes with higher-quality teachers have better outcomes in life.7

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Later in life, workforce training and education are most effective when they train workers in skills needed by local employers.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Rural areas where traditional industries are declining and where new employers may be moving in often experience a mismatch between the skills of local workers and those demanded by the new employers.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Training and retraining programs tend to be centralized and concentrated in areas with a higher population density, which puts many rural areas at a disadvantage.8

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Education benefits both the student and the community.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: It is true that some young people leave their hometowns to seek greater opportunity.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: However, it is also true that young families, drawn back home by family and social ties, are the largest source of in-migration in many rural communities.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Young families are more likely to come if they believe their children will get a good education.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Returnees often bring back important skills and experiences and make meaningful contributions to the local economy.9

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: An excellent example is Tim Lampkin, an MVSU graduate.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Tim grew up and graduated from high school in Clarksdale.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: After graduating from MVSU, he moved to Mobile for work.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: He wasn't gone long, though, before he felt called to return to make his home here in the Delta.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Since moving back, Tim has founded several businesses, as well as a nonprofit that helps people of color start and grow their own businesses.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Entrepreneurship and Small Business DevelopmentAs with Tim and his clients, entrepreneurship opportunities can motivate residents who have left rural communities to return home‑‑or to keep them from moving away in the first place.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Business ownership represents an important source of income and wealth for both owners and their employees.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Recognizing this fact, successful communities find ways to help residents turn what they know and do best, including skills they may have gained from industries in decline, into profitable small businesses.10One example of a community taking this approach is Clarksdale, Mississippi.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: About 10 years ago, civic and business leaders assessed what made Clarksdale special and how those characteristics could help the community thrive.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Since Clarksdale calls itself "Home of the Blues," attracting tourists using the local Blues culture seemed promising.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Over the years, Clarksdale has created new jobs by investing to improve its downtown, and has supported local businesses that cater to tourists interested in the community's musical heritage.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: This growth is also creating new businesses not directly related to tourism--businesses such as Urgent and Primary Care of Clarksdale.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Dr. Mary Williams opened her urgent care facility last spring, partly in response to the closure of nearby Quitman County Hospital.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Dr. Williams worked with local organizations to develop a business plan and obtain the financing needed to open a business that is critical to the community.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: DeWitt, Arkansas, is another rural community where entrepreneurship is sparking a local revival.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: DeWitt is a town of about 3,000 people.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Like Itta Bena and many small towns, it has seen a steady decline in population over the past few decades.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: The economy there is a mix of manufacturing and agriculture, and many families have farmed the land for generations, such as the family of Tami and Troy Hornbeck.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: The Hornbecks grew up in DeWitt, starting and eventually selling a successful business built on a new soybean varietal that grows well in the South.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: More recently, they have been helping lead a new industry in their community using waste vegetable oil from local restaurants and oil pressed from camelina, a crop farmers are beginning to grow locally.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: This cooperative effort involves a partnership between a community college, a university, the local government, farmers and restaurants, and a Community Development Financial Institution, or CDFI, among others.11While still in the early stages, it has led to the creation of several new businesses and imbued the town with a new sense of what is possible.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Entrepreneurs such as the Hornbecks and Dr. Williams need support to succeed, the kind of support HBCUs and other institutions of higher education have long provided.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: MVSU itself is supporting rural minority entrepreneurs through its participation in the HBCU Entrepreneurial Ecosystem Initiative, which teaches students how to start and grow a business.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: But inspiring stories like these are not as common as they could be.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Entrepreneurship has the potential to play a greater role in poor rural areas, particularly in areas whose residents are predominantly black and other people of color.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Recent surveys have found relatively high levels of interest in owning businesses among young people of color.12Indeed, nationwide, black women represent one of the fastest growing groups of entrepreneurs.13Yet research by the Federal Reserve suggests people of color experience greater challenges in gaining access to credit to start or expand businesses, which leads me to my last topic and the focus of this forum: access to financial services.14

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Access to Financial ServicesAccess to safe and affordable financial services is vital, especially among families with limited wealth‑‑whether they are looking to invest in education, start a business, or simply manage the ups and downs of life.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Family income and savings represent the largest source of funding for students' education.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: However, more than half of students or their families also borrow to finance their studies.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: And racial wealth disparities make black students more likely than white students to borrow for their education.15Similarly, racial wealth disparities mean access to credit is critical for would-be entrepreneurs who must borrow to supplement personal savings and support from friends and family.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Banks often consider credit scores when evaluating loan requests, however, and high-poverty regions tend to have a larger percentage of people with no established credit rating or a low credit score.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: This combination of low wealth and low credit scores limits access to credit or causes borrowers to turn to higher-cost credit.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Fortunately, CDFIs are helping potential borrowers improve their creditworthiness and providing them with safe and affordable credit.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: While CDFIs fill a critical gap in some communities, most consumers use other banks and credit unions.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: In rural areas, this often means a community bank.16Industry consolidation has led to a long-term decline in the number of community banks.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: While most rural communities continue to be relatively well served, that is less often the case in communities with high-poverty rates.17

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: In 2018, Federal Reserve staff members met with leaders in rural areas across the country that had recently experienced a bank branch closure.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: We found that small businesses, older people, and people with limited access to transportation are most affected.18We also learned that the loss of the branch often meant more than the loss of access to financial services; it also meant the loss of financial advice, local civic leadership, and an institution that brought needed customers to nearby businesses.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Regulation and supervision need to be carefully tailored to suit the size and business model of different types of institutions.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: At the Fed, we have renewed our efforts to avoid unnecessary regulatory burden on community banks, which provide essential credit in their local communities.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Another means to address the issue of branch closures is the Community Reinvestment Act, or CRA, which encourages banks to help meet the credit needs of the communities they are chartered to serve.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: The CRA has been an important tool for strengthening local communities.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: The trend toward fewer branches and increased use of technology to deliver financial services presents a particular challenge to our current approach to CRA evaluations.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: Specifically, the current regulations use a bank's branches to define its assessment area, the area for which it is evaluated for CRA purposes.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: To the extent that banks serve much broader areas using online or other non-branch delivery systems, or have so many assessment areas that examiners cannot do a thorough evaluation in each, the financial needs of many rural communities may be overlooked.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: We believe that revisions to the CRA's implementing regulations should more effectively encourage banks to seek opportunities in underserved areas.19

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: ConclusionTo summarize my main points today, people in rural communities who are struggling with persistent poverty need access to high-quality education from preschool through college.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: They need support for their aspirations to own their own businesses.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: And they need access to safe and affordable credit.

title: Encouraging Economic Development in High-Poverty Rural Communities
sentence_text: I will conclude where I began, by applauding both MVSU and Hope for their long-standing contribution toward bettering the lives of the people of Itta Bena and similar rural communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you to all the educators who are here with us in Washington or are joining us online.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I look forward to responding to your questions.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: But first, I have a few thoughts about the vital work you do as economics educators and its connection to what the Federal Reserve is trying to accomplish.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I promise to be brief, because it is a school night.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I am here today, and the Fed has organized this event, because of the importance of economics education.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Some of your students may go on to become professional economists, but all of them, I hope, will apply the valuable lessons and the skills they have gained from economics in other careers and in others aspects of their lives.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Studying economics can benefit students in multiple ways.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The lessons of economics are valuable in a wide variety of vocations.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Moreover, the knowledge gained will empower students as consumers, managers of their own finances, and as informed citizens.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Economics has been consistently useful to me over my career in law, finance, and government service.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: It is, of course, central to my current role as a monetary policymaker and financial regulator.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: In government, economic analysis is one of the principal tools we use in making policy decisions.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Among other things, economics is an essential facet of the science of public policy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Which ones sound good but don't work, or are actually counter-productive?

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Economics gives us the tools to answer those questions and help us make the best the decisions on behalf of the public.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Of course, economics is not only the basis for judgments and decisions made by the Fed and other government agencies.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: It also underpins the countless decisions by consumers, businesses, and investors that drive economic activity.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The concepts you teach and apply in the classroom guide those decisions and even help explain human behavior outside of the workings of the economy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: For example, to continue to grow and succeed, any business owner should understand the differences between fixed cost, variable cost, average cost, and marginal cost.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Businesses and investors need to understand present or discounted value, but so should any parent or grandparent starting a college fund.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Economics teaches us about the power of incentives, which are central to thinking about and understanding regulatory and tax policy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: But incentives also help motivate people in a variety of other settings, such as encouraging students to do their best in school, helping reduce traffic jams, or even nudging someone to save more or to exercise regularly.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Economics is a practical and powerful tool for understanding how we relate to each other.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: And that's why what you do for your students is so important.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Like all teachers, you are helping prepare them for success in life.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The knowledge you impart and the intellect and talents you help develop are tools that your students can use to achieve that success.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Economics teaches analytical and critical thinking skills useful to anyone.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Part of your students' success is their economic success as capable, creative, and productive members of the workforce and as consumers adept at managing their finances.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Your students benefit from this education, but so does everyone else in society.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We all benefit when better-educated citizens support economic policies that help our nation prosper.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We all benefit from the capability, creativity, and productivity of our workforce, because nothing is more important to a healthy and growing economy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Responsible consumers skilled in managing their finances are better prepared to weather bad times, and stronger household finances overall can help sustain economic growth and mitigate a downturn.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Stabilizing growth and mitigating a downturn, of course, are aspects of the Federal Reserve's mission.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Monetary policy can be a powerful tool to achieve these ends, but, in truth, its powers are dwarfed by larger forces, such as the productivity of the American people and the strength of their finances.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: By educating students and supporting their future contributions to the economy as workers and consumers, all teachers, especially economics teachers, are furthering our goals at the Fed, so let me offer my further thanks for making our job easier.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: To help support your work as teachers, the Federal Reserve Board and the 12 Reserve Banks conduct programs, organize events, and publish books to spread knowledge of economics, financial literacy, and the role of the Fed in promoting a healthy economy and financial system.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: You can find some of those resources at our websites: FederalReserve.gov and FederalReserveEducation.org.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Each of the Reserve Banks has community outreach and educational initiatives, and the outreach to economics teachers is coordinated by the System Economic Education Group, which has been chaired by Princeton Williams.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: At the Board of Governors, for some years we have operated a program called FedEd, which sends Board employees into high schools throughout the Washington, D.C., area.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: This outreach depends on several dozen volunteers from our staff--typically, recent college graduates--who help teach about the Fed, economics and finance, and answer questions about work opportunities at the Board.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve is dedicated to promoting diversity in our ranks and in the economics profession, and FedEd and other programs across the Federal Reserve System have helped advance this goal by reaching many schools with significant numbers of minority students.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Let me leave it there, and again thank you for participating in this town hall, and thank you for the valuable work you do every school day.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: It has been just eight months since the pandemic first gained a foothold on our shores, bringing with it the sharpest downturn on record, as well as the most forceful policy response in living memory.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Although it is too early for definitive conclusions, today I will offer a current assessment of the response to the economic fallout of this historic event and discuss the path ahead.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The Pre-COVID EconomyAs the coronavirus spread across the globe, the U.S. economy was in its 128th month of expansion—the longest in our recorded history—and was generally in a strong position.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Moderate growth continued at a slightly above-trend pace.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Labor market conditions were strong across a range of measures.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The unemployment rate was running at 50-year lows.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: PCE (personal consumption expenditures) inflation was running just below our 2 percent target.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The economy did face longer-term challenges, as all economies do.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Labor force participation among people in their prime working years had been trending down since the turn of the millennium, and productivity gains during the expansion were disappointing.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Income and wealth disparities had been growing for several decades.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: As the expansion continued its long run, however, productivity started to pick up, the labor market strengthened, and the benefits of growth began to be more widely shared.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: In particular, improved labor market conditions during the past few years encouraged more prime-age workers to rejoin or remain in the labor force.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Meanwhile, real wage gains for all workers picked up, especially for those in lower paying jobs.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Most economic forecasters expected the expansion and its benefits to continue, and with good reason.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: There was no economy-threatening asset bubble to pop and no unsustainable boom to bust.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: While nonfinancial business leverage appeared to be elevated, leverage in the household sector was moderate.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The banking system was strong, with robust levels of capital and liquidity.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The COVID-19 recession was unusual in that it was not triggered by a buildup of financial or economic imbalances.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Instead, the pandemic shock was essentially a case of a natural disaster hitting a healthy economy.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Given the condition of the economy, in the early stages of the crisis it seemed plausible that, with a rapid, forceful, and sustained policy response, many sectors of the economy would be able to bounce back strongly once the virus was under control.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: That response would need to come from actions across all levels of government, from health and fiscal authorities, and from the Federal Reserve.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: It also seemed likely that the sectors most affected by the pandemic—those relying on extensive in-person contact—would face a long and difficult path to recovery.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: These sectors and people working in them would likely need targeted and sustained policy support.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Some asked what the Fed could do to address what was essentially a medical emergency.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: We identified three ways that our tools could help limit the economic damage from the pandemic: providing stability and relief during the acute phase of the crisis when much of the economy was shut down; vigorously supporting the expansion when it came; and doing what we could to limit longer-run damage to the productive capacity of the economy.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The Recession and Nascent RecoveryWhen it became clear in late February that the disease was spreading worldwide, financial markets were roiled by a global flight to cash.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: By the end of the month, many important markets were faltering, raising the threat of a financial crisis that could exacerbate the economic fallout of the pandemic.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Widespread economic shutdowns began in March, and in the United States, with many sectors shut down or operating well below capacity, real GDP fell 31 percent in the second quarter on an annualized basis.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Employers slashed payrolls by 22 million, with those on temporary layoff rising by 17 million.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Broader measures of labor market conditions, such as labor force participation and those working part time for economic reasons, showed further damage.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: In response, we deployed the full range of tools at our disposal, cutting rates to their effective lower bound; conducting unprecedented quantities of asset purchases; and establishing a range of emergency lending facilities to restore market function and support the flow of credit to households, businesses, and state and local governments.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: We also implemented targeted and temporary measures to allow banks to better support their customers.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The fiscal response was truly extraordinary.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The unanimous passage of the CARES Act and three other bills passed with broad support in March and April established wide-ranging programs that are expected to provide roughly $3 trillion in economic support overall—by far the largest and most innovative fiscal response to an economic crisis since the Great Depression.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: What have these policies managed to accomplish so far?

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: First, the substantial fiscal aid has given vital support to households.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The rise in transfers supported necessary spending and contributed to a sharp increase in household saving.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Goods consumption is now above its pre-pandemic level.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Services consumption remains low, although it seems likely that much of this weakness is the byproduct of health concerns and social distancing, rather than reductions in income and wealth.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Consumption held up well through August after the expiration of expanded unemployment insurance benefits, indicating that savings from transfer payments continue to support economic activity.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: A recent Fed survey showed that households in July had surprisingly upbeat views of their current financial well-being, with 77 percent of adults either "doing okay" or "living comfortably," an improvement even over the reading immediately preceding the pandemic.1Still, since it appears that many will undergo extended periods of unemployment, there is likely to be a need for further support.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Second, aid to firms—in particular, the Paycheck Protection Program—and the general boost to aggregate demand have so far partly forestalled an expected wave of bankruptcies and lessened permanent layoffs.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Business investment appears to be on a renewed upward trajectory and new business formation similarly appears to be rebounding, pointing to some confidence in the path ahead.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Third, after briefly seizing up in March, financial markets have largely returned to normal functioning, albeit in the context of extensive ongoing policy support.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Financial conditions are highly accommodative, and credit is available on reasonable terms for many—though not all—households and businesses.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Interest-sensitive spending has been relatively strong, as shown in the housing and auto sectors.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Taken together, fiscal and monetary policy actions have so far supported a strong but incomplete recovery in demand and have—for now—substantially muted the normal recessionary dynamics that occur in a downturn.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: In a typical recession, there is a downward spiral in which layoffs lead to still lower demand, and subsequent additional layoffs.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: This dynamic was disrupted by the infusion of funds to households and businesses.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Prompt and forceful policy actions were also likely responsible for reducing risk aversion in financial markets and business decisions more broadly.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: While the combined effects of fiscal and monetary policy have aided the solid recovery of the labor market so far, there is still a long way to go.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Payrolls have now recovered roughly half of the 22 million decline.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: After rising to 14.7 percent in April, the unemployment rate is back to 7.9 percent, clearly a significant and rapid rebound.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: A broader measure that better captures current labor market conditions—by adjusting for mistaken characterizations of job status, and for the decline in labor force participation since February—is running around 11 percent.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The burdens of the downturn have not been evenly shared.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The initial job losses fell most heavily on lower-wage workers in service industries facing the public—job categories in which minorities and women are overrepresented.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: In August, employment of those in the bottom quartile of the wage distribution was still 21 percent below its February level, while it was only 4 percent lower for other workers.2Combined with the disproportionate effects of COVID on communities of color, and the overwhelming burden of childcare during quarantine and distance learning, which has fallen mostly on women, the pandemic is further widening divides in wealth and economic mobility.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The Road AheadI will now turn to the outlook.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The recovery has progressed more quickly than generally expected.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The most recent projections by FOMC (Federal Open Market Committee) participants at our September meeting show the recovery continuing at a solid pace.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The median participant saw unemployment declining to 4 percent and inflation reaching 2 percent by the end of 2023.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Of course, the economy may perform better or worse than expected.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The outlook remains highly uncertain, in part because it depends on controlling the spread and effects of the virus.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: There is a risk that the rapid initial gains from reopening may transition to a longer than expected slog back to full recovery as some segments struggle with the pandemic's continued fallout.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The pace of economic improvement has moderated since the outsize gains of May and June, as is evident in employment, income, and spending data.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The increase in permanent job loss, as well as recent layoffs, are also notable.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: We should continue do what we can to manage downside risks to the outlook.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: One such risk is that COVID-19 cases might again rise to levels that more significantly limit economic activity, not to mention the tragic effects on lives and well-being.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Managing this risk as the expansion continues will require following medical experts' guidance, including using masks and social-distancing measures.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: A second risk is that a prolonged slowing in the pace of improvement over time could trigger typical recessionary dynamics, as weakness feeds on weakness.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: A long period of unnecessarily slow progress could continue to exacerbate existing disparities in our economy.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: That would be tragic, especially in light of our country's progress on these issues in the years leading up to the pandemic.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The expansion is still far from complete.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: At this early stage, I would argue that the risks of policy intervention are still asymmetric.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Too little support would lead to a weak recovery, creating unnecessary hardship for households and businesses.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Over time, household insolvencies and business bankruptcies would rise, harming the productive capacity of the economy, and holding back wage growth.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: By contrast, the risks of overdoing it seem, for now, to be smaller.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Even if policy actions ultimately prove to be greater than needed, they will not go to waste.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The recovery will be stronger and move faster if monetary policy and fiscal policy continue to work side by side to provide support to the economy until it is clearly out of the woods.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Given this audience, I would be remiss were I not to mention our review of our monetary policy strategy, tools, and communications, which concluded recently with our adoption of a flexible average inflation-targeting regime.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: My colleagues and I have discussed this new framework in detail in recent remarks.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: Today I will just note that the underlying structure of the economy changes over time, and that the FOMC's framework for conducting monetary policy must keep pace.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The recent changes to our consensus statement reflect our evolving understanding of several important developments.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: There has been a decline in estimates of the potential or longer-run growth rate of the economy and in the general level of interest rates, presenting challenges for the ability of monetary policy to respond to a downturn.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: On a more positive note, we have seen that the economy can sustain historically high levels of employment, bringing significant societal benefits and without causing a troubling rise in inflation.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The new consensus statement acknowledges these developments and makes appropriate changes in our monetary policy framework to position the FOMC to best achieve its statutory goals.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The forward rate guidance adopted at our September meeting reflects our new consensus statement.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The new guidance says that, with inflation running persistently below our longer-run 2 percent goal, the Committee will aim to achieve inflation moderately above 2 percent for some time so that inflation averages 2 percent over time and longer-term inflation expectations remain well anchored at 2 percent.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The Committee expects to maintain an accommodative stance of policy until these outcomes are achieved.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: The Committee also left the target range for the federal funds rate unchanged at 0 to 1/4 percent, and it expects it will be appropriate to maintain this target range until labor market conditions have reached levels that are consistent with the Committee's assessments of maximum employment and inflation has risen to 2 percent and is on track to moderately exceed 2 percent for some time.

title: Recent Economic Developments and the Challenges Ahead
sentence_text: We expect that the new framework and guidance will support our efforts in pursuit of a strong economic recovery.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Thank you, Esther, for that introduction, and good morning.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The Kansas City Fed's Economic Policy Symposiums have consistently served as a vital platform for discussing the most challenging economic issues of the day.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Judging by the agenda and the papers, this year will be no exception.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: For the past year and a half, my colleagues and I on the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) have been conducting the first-ever public review of our monetary policy framework.1Earlier today we released a revised Statement on Longer-Run Goals and Monetary Policy Strategy, a document that lays out our goals, articulates our framework for monetary policy, and serves as the foundation for our policy actions.2Today I will discuss our review, the changes in the economy that motivated us to undertake it, and our revised statement, which encapsulates the main conclusions of the review.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Evolution of the Fed's Monetary Policy FrameworkWe began this public review in early 2019 to assess the monetary policy strategy, tools, and communications that would best foster achievement of our congressionally assigned goals of maximum employment and price stability over the years ahead in service to the American people.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Because the economy is always evolving, the FOMC's strategy for achieving its goals—our policy framework—must adapt to meet the new challenges that arise.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Forty years ago, the biggest problem our economy faced was high and rising inflation.3The Great Inflation demanded a clear focus on restoring the credibility of the FOMC's commitment to price stability.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Chair Paul Volcker brought that focus to bear, and the "Volcker disinflation," with the continuing stewardship of Alan Greenspan, led to the stabilization of inflation and inflation expectations in the 1990s at around 2 percent.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The monetary policies of the Volcker era laid the foundation for the long period of economic stability known as the Great Moderation.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: This new era brought new challenges to the conduct of monetary policy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Before the Great Moderation, expansions typically ended in overheating and rising inflation.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Since then, prior to the current pandemic-induced downturn, a series of historically long expansions had been more likely to end with episodes of financial instability, prompting essential efforts to substantially increase the strength and resilience of the financial system.4

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: By the early 2000s, many central banks around the world had adopted a monetary policy framework known as inflation targeting.5Although the precise features of inflation targeting differed from country to country, the core framework always articulated an inflation goal as a primary objective of monetary policy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Inflation targeting was also associated with increased communication and transparency designed to clarify the central bank's policy intentions.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: This emphasis on transparency reflected what was then a new appreciation that policy is most effective when it is clearly understood by the public.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Inflation-targeting central banks generally do not focus solely on inflation: Those with "flexible" inflation targets take into account economic stabilization in addition to their inflation objective.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Under Ben Bernanke's leadership, the Federal Reserve adopted many of the features associated with flexible inflation targeting.6We made great advances in transparency and communications, with the initiation of quarterly press conferences and the Summary of Economic Projections (SEP), which comprises the individual economic forecasts of FOMC participants.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: During that time, then–Board Vice Chair Janet Yellen led an effort on behalf of the FOMC to codify the Committee's approach to monetary policy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: In January 2012, the Committee issued its first Statement on Longer-Run Goals and Monetary Policy Strategy, which we often refer to as the consensus statement.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: A central part of this statement was the articulation of a longer-run inflation goal of 2 percent.7Because the structure of the labor market is strongly influenced by nonmonetary factors that can change over time, the Committee did not set a numerical objective for maximum employment.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: However, the statement affirmed the Committee's commitment to fulfilling both of its congressionally mandated goals.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The 2012 statement was a significant milestone, reflecting lessons learned from fighting high inflation as well as from experience around the world with flexible inflation targeting.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The statement largely articulated the policy framework the Committee had been following for some time.8

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Motivation for the ReviewThe completion of the original consensus statement in January 2012 occurred early on in the recovery from the Global Financial Crisis, when notions of what the "new normal" might bring were quite uncertain.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Since then, our understanding of the economy has evolved in ways that are central to monetary policy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Of course, the conduct of monetary policy has also evolved.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: A key purpose of our review has been to take stock of the lessons learned over this period and identify any further changes in our monetary policy framework that could enhance our ability to achieve our maximum-employment and price-stability objectives in the years ahead.9

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Our evolving understanding of four key economic developments motivated our review.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: First, assessments of the potential, or longer-run, growth rate of the economy have declined.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: For example, since January 2012, the median estimate of potential growth from FOMC participants has fallen from 2.5 percent to 1.8 percent (seefigure 1).

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Some slowing in growth relative to earlier decades was to be expected, reflecting slowing population growth and the aging of the population.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: More troubling has been the decline in productivity growth, which is the primary driver of improving living standards over time.10

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Second, the general level of interest rates has fallen both here in the United States and around the world.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Estimates of the neutral federal funds rate, which is the rate consistent with the economy operating at full strength and with stable inflation, have fallen substantially, in large part reflecting a fall in the equilibrium real interest rate, or "r-star."

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: This rate is not affected by monetary policy but instead is driven by fundamental factors in the economy, including demographics and productivity growth—the same factors that drive potential economic growth.11The median estimate from FOMC participants of the neutral federal funds rate has fallen by nearly half since early 2012, from 4.25 percent to 2.5 percent (seefigure 2).

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: This decline in assessments of the neutral federal funds rate has profound implications for monetary policy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: With interest rates generally running closer to their effective lower bound even in good times, the Fed has less scope to support the economy during an economic downturn by simply cutting the federal funds rate.12The result can be worse economic outcomes in terms of both employment and price stability, with the costs of such outcomes likely falling hardest on those least able to bear them.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Third, and on a happier note, the record-long expansion that ended earlier this year led to the best labor market we had seen in some time.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The unemployment rate hovered near 50-year lows for roughly 2 years, well below most estimates of its sustainable level.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: And the unemployment rate captures only part of the story.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Having declined significantly in the five years following the crisis, the labor force participation rate flattened out and began rising even though the aging of the population suggested that it should keep falling.13For individuals in their prime working years, the participation rate fully retraced its post-crisis decline, defying earlier assessments that the Global Financial Crisis might cause permanent structural damage to the labor market.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Moreover, as the long expansion continued, the gains began to be shared more widely across society.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The Black and Hispanic unemployment rates reached record lows, and the differentials between these rates and the white unemployment rate narrowed to their lowest levels on record.14As we heard repeatedly in ourFed Listensevents, the robust job market was delivering life-changing gains for many individuals, families, and communities, particularly at the lower end of the income spectrum.15In addition, many who had been left behind for too long were finding jobs, benefiting their families and communities, and increasing the productive capacity of our economy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Before the pandemic, there was every reason to expect that these gains would continue.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: It is hard to overstate the benefits of sustaining a strong labor market, a key national goal that will require a range of policies in addition to supportive monetary policy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Fourth, the historically strong labor market did not trigger a significant rise in inflation.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Over the years, forecasts from FOMC participants and private-sector analysts routinely showed a return to 2 percent inflation, but these forecasts were never realized on a sustained basis (seefigure 3).

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Inflation forecasts are typically predicated on estimates of the natural rate of unemployment, or "u-star," and of how much upward pressure on inflation arises when the unemployment rate falls relative to u-star.16As the unemployment rate moved lower and inflation remained muted, estimates of u-star were revised down.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: For example, the median estimate from FOMC participants declined from 5.5 percent in 2012 to 4.1 percent at present (seefigure 4).

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The muted responsiveness of inflation to labor market tightness, which we refer to as the flattening of the Phillips curve, also contributed to low inflation outcomes.17In addition, longer-term inflation expectations, which we have long seen as an important driver of actual inflation, and global disinflationary pressures may have been holding down inflation more than was generally anticipated.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Other advanced economies have also struggled to achieve their inflation goals in recent decades.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The persistent undershoot of inflation from our 2 percent longer-run objective is a cause for concern.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Many find it counterintuitive that the Fed would want to push up inflation.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: After all, low and stable inflation is essential for a well-functioning economy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: And we are certainly mindful that higher prices for essential items, such as food, gasoline, and shelter, add to the burdens faced by many families, especially those struggling with lost jobs and incomes.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: However, inflation that is persistently too low can pose serious risks to the economy.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Inflation that runs below its desired level can lead to an unwelcome fall in longer-term inflation expectations, which, in turn, can pull actual inflation even lower, resulting in an adverse cycle of ever-lower inflation and inflation expectations.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: This dynamic is a problem because expected inflation feeds directly into the general level of interest rates.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Well-anchored inflation expectations are critical for giving the Fed the latitude to support employment when necessary without destabilizing inflation.18But if inflation expectations fall below our 2 percent objective, interest rates would decline in tandem.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: In turn, we would have less scope to cut interest rates to boost employment during an economic downturn, further diminishing our capacity to stabilize the economy through cutting interest rates.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: We have seen this adverse dynamic play out in other major economies around the world and have learned that once it sets in, it can be very difficult to overcome.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: We want to do what we can to prevent such a dynamic from happening here.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: Elements of the ReviewWe began our review with these changes in the economy in mind.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: The review had three pillars: a series ofFed Listensevents held around the country, a flagship research conference, and a series of Committee discussions supported by rigorous staff analysis.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: As is appropriate in our democratic society, we have sought extensive engagement with the public throughout the review.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
sentence_text: TheFed Listensevents built on a long-standing practice around the Federal Reserve System of engaging with community groups.

title: New Economic Challenges and the Fed's Monetary Policy Review
