title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Good morning, and welcome to the inaugural conference on the International Roles of the U.S. Dollar.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you all for participating and for lending your expertise on this important topic.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: This conference marks the first use of our new Martin Conference Center, which I hope you enjoy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The international financial and monetary system that emerged after World War II has been defined by the centrality of the dollar.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: It is the world's reserve currency and the most widely used for payments and investments.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: As outlined in recent work by Board staff, this global preeminence has been supported by the depth and liquidity of U.S. financial markets, the size and strength of the U.S. economy, its stability and openness to trade and capital flows, and international trust in U.S. institutions and the rule of law.1Professor Barry Eichengreen will expand on some of these themes later this morning.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The dollar's international role holds multiple benefits.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: For the United States, it lowers transaction fees and borrowing costs for U.S. households, businesses, and the government.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Its ubiquity helps contain uncertainty and, relatedly, the cost of hedging for domestic households and businesses.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: For foreign economies, the wide use of the dollar allows borrowers to have access to a broad pool of lenders and investors, which reduces their funding and transaction costs.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The benefits of the dollar as the dominant reserve currency have generated an extensive academic literature.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Yesterday's paper on the Treasury market by Alexandra Tabova and Frank Warnock extends that work in meaningful ways.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve's strong commitment to our price stability mandate contributes to the widespread confidence in the dollar as a store of value.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: To that end, my colleagues and I are acutely focused on returning inflation to our 2 percent objective.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Meeting our dual mandate also depends on maintaining financial stability.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The Fed's commitment to both our dual mandate and financial stability encourages the international community to hold and use dollars.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The wide use of the dollar globally can also pose financial stability challenges that can materially affect households, businesses, and markets.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: For that reason, the Federal Reserve has played a key role in promoting financial stability and supporting the use of dollars internationally through our liquidity facilities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The central bank liquidity swap lines provide foreign central banks with the capacity to deliver U.S. dollar funding to institutions in their jurisdictions.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: And the Foreign and International Monetary Authorities (FIMA) Repo Facility allows approved FIMA account holders the option to temporarily exchange their U.S. Treasury securities held by the Federal Reserve for U.S. dollars.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: These facilities serve as liquidity backstops so that holders of dollar assets and participants in dollar funding markets can be confident that strains will be eased when these markets come under stress.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: That assurance, in turn, mitigates the effect of such strains on the flow of credit to U.S. households and businesses.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Both facilities enhance the standing of the dollar as the dominant global currency.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The swap lines were extensively used during the Global Financial Crisis, the 2011 euro-area debt crisis, and the financial turmoil at the outset of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The paper on central bank swap lines presented yesterday by Gerardo Ferrara, Philippe Mueller, Ganesh Viswanath-Natraj, and Junxuan Wang provides novel micro-level evidence on the usefulness of swap lines in providing cross-border liquidity to support the real economy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Looking forward, rapid changes are taking place in the global monetary system that may affect the international role of the dollar in the future.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Most major economies already have or are in the process of developing instant, 24/7 payments.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Our own FedNow service will be coming online in 2023.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: And in light of the tremendous growth in crypto-assets and stablecoins, the Federal Reserve is examining whether a U.S. central bank digital currency (CBDC) would improve on an already safe and efficient domestic payments system.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: As the Fed's white paper on this topic notes, a U.S. CBDC could also potentially help maintain the dollar's international standing.2As we consider feedback from the paper, we will be thinking not just about the current state of the world, but also how the global financial system might evolve over the next 5 to 10 years.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The paper by Jiakai Chen and Asani Sarkar, which is on today's program, and our distinguished panelists on this topic this afternoon, will provide important insights on this issue.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: To summarize, I would like to stress the importance of the dollar to the U.S. and global economies and financial markets.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: It is critical that we understand the channels, connections, and effects of the role of the dollar.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: In closing, I want to thank you all for taking the time to join our discussion on the dollar's international roles.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: This conference brings together world-class researchers, practitioners, and policymakers dedicated to understanding and addressing these vital issues.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I look forward to their insights and I hope you enjoy the conference.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: It is a great pleasure to welcome all the attendees to RES 2022.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The National Center for American Indian Enterprise Development has been a strong and consistent partner to the Federal Reserve, collaborating with us on small business COVID surveys, serving on the Leadership Council for the Minneapolis Fed’s Center for Indian Country Development, and moderating our policy webinar series on tribal enterprise diversification, just to name a few.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Trust is earned and developed through relationships.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: This is particularly important in Indian Country.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve has built an enduring and sturdy bond with the National Center, and we value that partnership.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We are excited to be participating in this year’s conference, learning alongside you.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: There is undoubtedly more research and engagement to be done on the specific and unique economic needs of tribal nations and Indigenous communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: RES 2022 is a great meeting ground for such collaboration.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The best insight and analysis come from people who live and work in communities and have an inside view of the struggles and opportunities within.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve System has made a priority of engaging with leaders and stakeholders on opportunities most relevant to tribal economic prosperity.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: For example, input from tribal stakeholders has been invaluable to informing the important work of modernizing the Community Reinvestment Act, which was incorporated into the recently published proposal that we are looking forward to getting comments on.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We also value the growing representation of tribal voices on our boards of directors and advisory councils at Reserve Banks, helping us to better understand economic conditions in Indian Country.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Many of you are aware of the Center for Indian Country Development (CICD), our national institute dedicated to helping tribes reach their full economic potential.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We are excited to be expanding its capacity to conduct economic research and data analysis to support the long-term economic prosperity of Indian Country, in partnership with Indian Country.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We look forward to CICD’s ongoing collaboration with tribal communities on research and data.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Additionally, an initial St. Louis Fed partnership with the Osage Nation, to provide youth financial education, has led to partnerships with tribal governments across the country that provide personal finance education, often in their Native languages.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Tribal leaders nationwide have also joined recent listening sessions to discuss the impacts of inflation.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Similar sessions were held on our pandemic response facilities, which were adapted after hearing their input.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Other Federal Reserve partnerships with Indian Country include initiatives on access to credit; Native community development financial institutions; financial education programs tailored to early childhood, secondary, and higher education; workforce development; housing; social services; and elder programs.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: And as part of our ongoing effort to deepen our understanding of tribal economies, last year, the Federal Reserve Board announced that we had joined the Central Bank Network for Indigenous Inclusion, along with the Reserve Bank of New Zealand, the Bank of Canada, and the Reserve Bank of Australia.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: This is part of our commitment to learning best practices and expanding our international partnerships with central banks that are similarly invested in supporting Indigenous people and communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: The Federal Reserve works for all of us, and our research and analysis must reflect the specific needs and circumstances of all of our communities.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I am grateful for our partnership with the National Center for American Indian Enterprise Development, and I want to thank you, as well as all our colleagues, advisors, and stakeholders who help us work toward a stable and inclusive economy for all.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Thank you for the opportunity to speak with you today.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Let me first pause to recognize the millions who are suffering the tragic consequences of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: At the Federal Reserve, our monetary policy is guided by the dual mandate to promote maximum employment and stable prices.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: From that standpoint, the current picture is plain to see: The labor market is very strong, and inflation is much too high.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: My colleagues and I are acutely aware that high inflation imposes significant hardship, especially on those least able to meet the higher costs of essentials like food, housing, and transportation.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: There is an obvious need to move expeditiously to return the stance of monetary policy to a more neutral level, and then to move to more restrictive levels if that is what is required to restore price stability.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: We are committed to restoring price stability while preserving a strong labor market.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: At our meeting that concluded last week, we took several steps in pursuit of these goals: We raised our policy interest rate for the first time since the start of the pandemic and said that we anticipate that ongoing rate increases will be appropriate to reach our objectives.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: We also said that we expect to begin reducing the size of our balance sheet at a coming meeting.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In my press conference, I noted that action could come as soon as our next meeting in May, though that is not a decision that we have made.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: These actions, along with the adjustments we have made since last fall, represent a substantial firming in the stance of policy with the intention of restoring price stability.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In my comments today, I will first discuss the economic conditions that warrant these actions and then address the path ahead for monetary policy.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The Labor Market Is Very Strong and Extremely TightTo begin with employment, in the last few years of the historically long expansion that ended with the arrival of the pandemic, we saw the remarkable benefits of an extended period of strong labor market conditions.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: We seek to foster another long expansion in order to realize those benefits again.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The labor market has substantial momentum.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Employment growth powered through the difficult Omicron wave, adding 1.75 million jobs over the past three months.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The unemployment rate has fallen to 3.8 percent, near historical lows, and has reached this level much faster than anticipated by most forecasters (figure 1).

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: While disparities in employment remain, job growth has been widespread across racial, ethnic, and demographic groups.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: By many measures, the labor market is extremely tight, significantly tighter than the very strong job market just before the pandemic.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: There are far more job openings going unfilled today than before the pandemic, despite today's unemployment rate being higher.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Indeed, there are a record 1.7 posted job openings for each person who is looking for work.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Record numbers of people are quitting jobs each month, typically to take another job with higher pay.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: And nominal wages are rising at the fastest pace in decades, with the gains strongest for those at the lower end of the wage distribution and among production and nonsupervisory workers (figure 2).

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: It is worth considering why the labor market is so tight, given that the unemployment rate is actually higher than it was before the pandemic.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: One explanation is that the natural rate of unemployment may be temporarily elevated, so wage pressure is greater for any given level of unemployment.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The sheer volume of hiring may have taxed the capacity of the market to bring workers and jobs together.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The Delta and Omicron variants complicated hiring, and the strong financial position of households may have allowed some to be more selective in their job search.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Over time, we might expect these factors to fade, reducing pressure in the job market.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: A second source of labor market tightness is that the labor force participation rate dropped sharply in the pandemic and has only partly recovered.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: As a result, the labor force remains below its pre-pandemic trend (figure 3).

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Total demand for labor, measured by total employment plus posted job openings, has substantially recovered and far exceeds the size of the workforce.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: About half of the shortfall in labor force participation is attributable to retirements during the pandemic.1History suggests that most of those retirees are unlikely to reenter the workforce.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: But some nonparticipation is due to factors that may fade with time, such as caregiving needs and fear of contracting COVID-19.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: With prime-aged participation still well below its pre-pandemic level, there is room for further progress.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: A more complete rebound is, however, likely to take some time.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Increases in labor force participation often substantially lag declines in unemployment.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Overall, the labor market is strong but showing a clear imbalance of supply and demand.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Our monetary policy tools cannot help with labor supply in the near term, but in a long expansion, the factors holding back supply will likely ease.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In the meantime, we aim to use our tools to moderate demand growth, thereby facilitating continued, sustainable increases in employment and wages.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The Inflation Outlook Has Deteriorated SignificantlyTurning to price stability, the inflation outlook had deteriorated significantly this year even before Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The rise in inflation has been much greater and more persistent than forecasters generally expected.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: For example, at the time of our June 2021 meeting, every Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) participant and all but one of 35 submissions in the Survey of Professional Forecasters predicted that 2021 inflation would be below 4 percent.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Inflation came in at 5.5 percent.2

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: For a time, moderate inflation forecasts looked plausible—the one-month headline and core inflation rates declined steadily from April through September.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: But inflation moved up sharply in the fall, and, just since our December meeting, the median FOMC projection for year-end 2022 jumped from 2.6 percent to 4.3 percent.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Why have forecasts been so far off?

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In my view, an important part of the explanation is that forecasters widely underestimated the severity and persistence of supply-side frictions, which, when combined with strong demand, especially for durable goods, produced surprisingly high inflation.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The pandemic and the associated shutdown and reopening of the economy caused a serious upheaval in many parts of the economy, snarling supply chains, constraining labor supply, and creating a major boom in demand for goods and a bust in services demand.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The combination of the surge in goods demand with supply chain bottlenecks led to sharply rising goods prices (figure 4).

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The most notable example here is motor vehicles.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Prices soared across the vehicles sector as booming demand was met by a sharpdeclinein global production during the summer of 2021, owing to shortages of computer chips.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Production remains below pre-pandemic levels, and an expected sharp decline in prices has been repeatedly postponed.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Many forecasters, including FOMC participants, had been expecting inflation to cool in the second half of last year, as the economy started going back to normal after vaccines became widely available.3Expectations were that the supply-side damage would begin to heal.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Schools would reopen—freeing parents to return to work—and labor supply would begin bouncing back, kinks in supply chains would begin resolving, and consumption would start rotating back to services, all of which could reduce price pressures.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: While schools are open, none of the other expectations has been fully met.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Part of the reason may be that, contrary to expectations, COVID has not gone away with the arrival of vaccines.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In fact, we are now headed once again into more COVID-related supply disruptions from China.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: It continues to seem likely that hoped-for supply-side healing will come over time as the world ultimately settles into some new normal, but the timing and scope of that relief are highly uncertain.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In the meantime, as we set policy, we will be looking to actual progress on these issues and not assuming significant near-term supply-side relief.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The Policy ResponseAs the magnitude and persistence of the increase in inflation became increasingly clear over the second half of last year, and as the job market recovery accelerated beyond expectations, the FOMC pivoted to progressively less accommodative monetary policy.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In June, the median FOMC participant projected that the federal funds rate would remain at its effective lower bound through the end of 2022, and as the news came in, the projected policy paths shifted higher (figure 5).

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The median projection that accompanied last week's 25 basis point rate increase shows the federal funds rate at 1.9 percent by the end of this year and rising above its estimated longer-run normal value in 2023.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The latest FOMC statement also indicates that the Committee expects to begin reducing the size of our balance sheet at a coming meeting.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: I believe that these policy actions and those to come will help bring inflation down near 2 percent over the next 3 years.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: As always, our policy projections are not a Committee decision or fixed plan.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Instead, they are a summary of what the FOMC participants see as the most likely case going forward.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The events of the past four weeks remind us that, in tumultuous times, what seems like the most likely scenario may change quite quickly: Each Summary of Economic Projections reflects a point in time and can become outdated quickly at times like these, when events are developing rapidly.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Thus, my main message today is that, as the outlook evolves, we will adjust policy as needed in order to ensure a return to price stability with a strong job market.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Let me now turn to three questions about the likely evolution of policy.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: How will fallout from the invasion of Ukraine affect the economy and monetary policy?Russia's invasion of Ukraine may have significant effects on the world economy and the U.S. economy.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The magnitude and persistence of these effects remain highly uncertain and depend on events yet to come.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Russia is one of the world's largest producers of commodities, and Ukraine is a key producer of several commodities as well, including wheat and neon, which is used in the production of computer chips.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: There is no recent experience with significant market disruption across such a broad range of commodities.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In addition to the direct effects from higher global oil and commodity prices, the invasion and related events are likely to restrain economic activity abroad and further disrupt supply chains, which would create spillovers to the U.S. economy.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: We might look to the historical experience with oil price shocks in the 1970s—not a happy story.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Fortunately, the United States is now much better situated to weather oil price shocks.4We are now the world's largest producer of oil, and our economy is significantly less oil intensive than in the 1970s.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Today a rise in oil prices has mixed effects on the economy, lowering real household incomes and thus demand, but raising investment in drilling over time and benefiting oil-producing areas more generally.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: On net, oil shocks tend to weigh on output in the U.S. economy, but by far less than in the 1970s.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Second, how likely is it that monetary policy can lower inflation without causing a recession?Our goal is to restore price stability while fostering another long expansion and sustaining a strong labor market.In the FOMC participant projections I just described, the economy achieves a soft landing, with inflation coming down and unemployment holding steady.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Growth slows as the very fast growth from the early stages of reopening fades, the effects of fiscal support wane, and monetary policy accommodation is removed.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Some have argued that history stacks the odds against achieving a soft landing, and point to the 1994 episode as the only successful soft landing in the postwar period.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: I believe that the historical record provides some grounds for optimism: Soft, or at least soft-ish, landings have been relatively common in U.S. monetary history.5In three episodes—in 1965, 1984, and 1994—the Fed raised the federal funds rate significantly in response to perceived overheating without precipitating a recession (figure 6).6In other cases, recessions chronologically followed the conclusion of a tightening cycle, but the recessions were not apparently due to excessive tightening of monetary policy.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: For example, the tightening from 2015 to 2019 was followed by the pandemic-induced recession.7

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: I hasten to add that no one expects that bringing about a soft landing will be straightforward in the current context—very little is straightforward in the current context.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: And monetary policy is often said to be a blunt instrument, not capable of surgical precision.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: My colleagues and I will do our very best to succeed in this challenging task.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: It is worth noting that today the economy is very strong and is well positioned to handle tighter monetary policy.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Finally, what will it take to restore price stability?The ultimate responsibility for price stability rests with the Federal Reserve.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Price stability is essential if we are going to have another sustained period of strong labor market conditions.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: I believe that the policy approach that I have laid out is well suited to achieving this outcome.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: We will take the necessary steps to ensure a return to price stability.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In particular, if we conclude that it is appropriate to move more aggressively by raising the federal funds rate by more than 25 basis points at a meeting or meetings, we will do so.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: And if we determine that we need to tighten beyond common measures of neutral and into a more restrictive stance, we will do that as well.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Our monetary policy framework, as embodied in our Statement on Longer-Run Goals and Monetary Policy Strategy, emphasizes that having longer-term inflation expectations anchored at our longer-run objective of 2 percent helps us achieve both our dual-mandate objectives.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: While we cannot measure longer-term expectations directly, we monitor a variety of survey- and market-based indicators.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In the recent period, short-term inflation expectations have, of course, risen with inflation, but longer-run expectations remain well anchored in their historical ranges (figure 7).

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: The added near-term upward pressure from the invasion of Ukraine on inflation from energy, food, and other commodities comes at a time of already too high inflation.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: In normal times, when employment and inflation are close to our objectives, monetary policy would look through a brief burst of inflation associated with commodity price shocks.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: However, the risk is rising that an extended period of high inflation could push longer-term expectations uncomfortably higher, which underscores the need for the Committee to move expeditiously as I have described.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: ConclusionThe past two years have been extraordinarily challenging for many Americans.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Two years ago, more than 20 million people were losing their jobs, millions were falling ill, and lives were being disrupted.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: We have made enormous strides since then.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Today, as I have discussed, the labor market is very strong.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: But, to end where I began, inflation is much too high.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: We have the necessary tools, and we will use them to restore price stability.

title: Restoring Price Stability
sentence_text: Note:On April 7, 2022, the legend for Figure 3 was corrected to "CPS employment plus job openings."

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you, President Gayle, and thank you for the invitation to visit today.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: I am fortunate to have been accompanied from Washington by a very distinguished graduate of Spelman College, Class of 1986 and member of Delta Sigma Theta, my Federal Reserve colleague Governor Lisa Cook.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: There is no greater testament to Spelman's historic legacy than the achievements of outstanding women like Governor Cook.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: One part of that legacy is Spelman's tradition of promoting education in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics).

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Governor Cook's research highlights the key role of such education in preparing individuals to be inventors and innovators who can generate ideas that will add to our body of knowledge, increase productivity, and generate higher living standards.1Her work is just one example of how Spelman women continue to make historic contributions in science, the arts, technology, medicine, and other fields.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: I look forward to our conversation, and I thought I might frame it by talking about the Federal Reserve's actions to promote a healthy economy, and how those actions relate to questions students in this audience may be asking about the future.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: For example, I am sure that students are wondering what kind of a job market and economy you will be entering when you complete your education.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Congress assigned the Fed the dual mandate goals of maximum employment and price stability.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Both goals are essential aspects of a healthy economy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Congress also gave the Fed a precious grant of independence from direct political control to allow us to pursue those goals without consideration of political matters.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Other major central banks in democratic societies have similar grants of independence, and this institutional arrangement has a strong track record of producing better policy outcomes for the benefit of the public.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: To begin with our maximum employment goal, I am glad to say that, by many measures, conditions in the labor market are very strong.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: A couple of years ago, as the pandemic receded and the economy reopened, the number of job openings grew to greatly exceed the supply of people available to work, leaving a widespread shortage of workers.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Today, labor market conditions remain very strong, and the economy is returning to a better balance between the demand for and supply of workers.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The pace at which the economy is creating new jobs remains strong, and has been slowing toward a more sustainable level.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: That gradual slowing has come in part due to the efforts of the Fed to slow the growth of the economy to help reduce inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: After declining sharply during the pandemic, the supply of workers has bounced back, as people have come back into the labor force and as immigration has returned to pre-pandemic levels.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Partly because of that labor force growth, the unemployment rate has edged up over the second half of the year, though it remains historically low at 3.9 percent.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The increase in participation has been particularly strong among women in the prime working ages of 25 to 54, which surged to an all-time high earlier this year, and which remains well above pre-pandemic levels.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Wage growth remains high but has been gradually moving toward levels that would be more consistent with 2 percent price inflation over time, and real wages are growing again as inflation declines.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: As for price stability, the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) has a longer-run goal of 2 percent inflation.2After running below 2 percent for over a decade, inflation increased sharply in 2021, in the United States and in many other countries around the world.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: High inflation imposes a significant hardship on all households and is especially painful for those least able to meet the higher costs of essentials like food, housing, and transportation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Beginning in early 2022, we reacted forcefully, raising our policy interest rate and decreasing the size of our balance sheet to help slow the economy and bring down inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Inflation has declined to 3 percent over the 12 months ending in October, but after factoring out energy and food prices, which tend to be volatile, what we call "core" inflation is still 3.5 percent, well above our 2 percent objective.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Over the six months ending in October, core inflation ran at an annual rate of 2.5 percent, and while the lower inflation readings of the past few months are welcome, that progress must continue if we are to reach our 2 percent objective.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: High inflation initially emerged from a collision between very strong demand and pandemic-constrained supply.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The normalization of supply and demand conditions has played a critical role in the disinflation so far, as has the substantial tightening of monetary policy and overall financial conditions over the past two years.3The strong actions we have taken have moved our policy rate well into restrictive territory, meaning that tight monetary policy is putting downward pressure on economic activity and inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Monetary policy is thought to affect economic conditions with a lag, and the full effects of our tightening have likely not yet been felt.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The forcefulness of our response to inflation also helped maintain the Fed's hard-won credibility, ensuring that the public's expectations of future inflation remain well-anchored.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Having come so far so quickly, the FOMC is moving forward carefully, as the risks of under- and over-tightening are becoming more balanced.4

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: As the demand- and supply-related effects of the pandemic continue to unwind, uncertainty about the outlook for the economy is unusually elevated.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Like most forecasters, my colleagues and I anticipate that growth in spending and output will slow over the next year, as the effects of the pandemic and the reopening fade and as restrictive monetary policy weighs on aggregate demand.5The FOMC is strongly committed to bringing inflation down to 2 percent over time, and to keeping policy restrictive until we are confident that inflation is on a path to that objective.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: It would be premature to conclude with confidence that we have achieved a sufficiently restrictive stance, or to speculate on when policy might ease.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We are prepared to tighten policy further if it becomes appropriate to do so.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We are making decisions meeting by meeting, based on the totality of the incoming data and their implications for the outlook for economic activity and inflation, as well as the balance of risks.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: That is an overview of what my colleagues and I at the Fed are trying to accomplish.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The bottom line, if you are a student, is that we have made considerable progress in reducing high inflation while maintaining a strong labor market, with a lot of opportunity for new graduates.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The unemployment rate has risen a bit, but it is still very low by historical standards, and by many measures it is a great time to start your career.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: You will face challenging decisions soon about what professions to enter, and what companies and institutions to work for.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Some of you will become entrepreneurs.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: You have already made one really good decision, and that is coming to Spelman.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Whatever opportunities and challenges emerge, education will continue to be a key to success.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Higher education is an investment, and not just of money.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: You are investing your time and great effort to gain knowledge and skills that are preparing you for successful careers.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Your success will make for a stronger economy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: For our part, at the Fed we are doing our best to foster an economy that gives you the best opportunity to succeed.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: With that, I will hand it back to you, President Gayle.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you for the opportunity to participate in today's panel discussion.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: My assigned topic is U.S. monetary policy in the current global inflation episode.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: I will briefly address the U.S. outlook and then turn to three broader questions raised by the historic events of the pandemic era.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: U.S. inflation has come down over the past year but remains well above our 2 percent target (figure 1).1My colleagues and I are gratified by this progress but expect that the process of getting inflation sustainably down to 2 percent has a long way to go.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The labor market remains tight, although improvements in labor supply and a gradual easing in demand continue to move it into better balance.2Gross domestic product growth in the third quarter was quite strong, but, like most forecasters, we expect growth to moderate in coming quarters.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Of course, that remains to be seen, and we are attentive to the risk that stronger growth could undermine further progress in restoring balance to the labor market and in bringing inflation down, which could warrant a response from monetary policy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) is committed to achieving a stance of monetary policy that is sufficiently restrictive to bring inflation down to 2 percent over time; we are not confident that we have achieved such a stance.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We know that ongoing progress toward our 2 percent goal is not assured: Inflation has given us a few head fakes.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: If it becomes appropriate to tighten policy further, we will not hesitate to do so.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We will continue to move carefully, however, allowing us to address both the risk of being misled by a few good months of data, and the risk of overtightening.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We are making decisions meeting by meeting, based on the totality of the incoming data and their implications for the outlook for economic activity and inflation, as well as the balance of risks, determining the extent of additional policy firming that may be appropriate to return inflation to 2 percent over time.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We will keep at it until the job is done.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: With that, I will turn to three questions that have arisen from the receding but still elevated inflation we are experiencing today.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The first question is, with the benefit of 2‑1/2 years to look back, what we can say about the initial causes and ongoing policy implications of the current inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: After running below our 2 percent target over the first year of the pandemic, core PCE (personal consumption expenditures) inflation rose sharply in March 2021.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Economic forecasters generally did not see this coming, as shown by the February 2021 Survey of Professional Forecasters, which showed core PCE inflation running at or below target over the subsequent three years.3The real-time questions for policymakers were what caused the high inflation and how policy should react.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: At the outset, many forecasters and analysts, including FOMC participants, viewed the sudden upturn in inflation as mostly a function of pandemic-related shifts in the composition of demand, a disruption of supply chains, and a sharp decline in labor supply.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The resulting supply and demand imbalances led to large increases in the prices of a range of items most directly affected by the pandemic, especially goods.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: In this view, as the pandemic abated, our dynamic and flexible economy was likely to adapt fairly quickly.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Supply disruptions and shortages would diminish.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Labor supply would rebound, aided by the arrival of vaccines and the reopening of schools.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Elevated demand for goods would shift back to services.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Inflation would ease reasonably quickly without the need for a significant policy response.4

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Indeed, although monthly core PCE inflation spiked in March and April of 2021, beginning in May it declined for five consecutive months, providing some support for this view (figure 2).

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: But in the fourth quarter of 2021, the data clearly changed amid waves of new COVID-19 variants, with only gradual progress in restoring global supply chains, and relatively few workers rejoining the labor force.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: That lack of progress, combined with very strong demand from households, contributed to a tight economy and a historically tight labor market, and more persistent high inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The Committee signaled a change in our policy approach, and financial conditions began to tighten.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: A new shock arrived in February 2022, when Russia invaded Ukraine, resulting in a sharp increase in energy and other commodity prices.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: When we lifted off in March, it was clear that bringing down inflation would depend both on the unwinding of the unprecedented pandemic-related demand and supply distortions and on our tightening of monetary policy, which would slow the growth of aggregate demand, allowing supply time to catch up.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Today, these two processes are working together to bring inflation down.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The FOMC has raised the federal funds rate target range by 5-1/4 percentage points and reduced our securities holdings by more than $1 trillion.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Monetary policy is in restrictive territory and putting downward pressure on demand and inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The unwinding of pandemic-related supply and demand distortions is playing an important role in the decline of inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: For example, wage growth has steadily fallen by most measures since mid-2022 (figure 3), despite continued robust job gains, reflecting a resurgence in labor supply thanks to higher labor force participation and a return of immigration to pre-pandemic levels.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: While the broader supply recovery continues, it is not clear how much more will be achieved by additional supply-side improvements.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Going forward, it may be that a greater share of the progress in reducing inflation will have to come from tight monetary policy restraining the growth of aggregate demand.5

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Turning to my second question, for many years, it has been generally thought that monetary policy should limit its response to, or "look through," supply shocks to the extent that they are temporary and idiosyncratic.6Many argue as well that, in the future, supply disruptions are likely to be more frequent or more persistent than in the decades just before the pandemic.7A second question, then, is what we have learned about the standard "looking through" approach.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The idea that the response to the inflationary effects of supply shocks should be attenuated arises, in part, from the tradeoff presented by those shocks.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Supply shocks tend to move prices and employment in opposite directions, whereas monetary policy pushes each in the same direction.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Therefore, the response of monetary policy to higher prices stemming from an adverse supply shock should be attenuated because it would otherwise amplify the unwanted decline in employment.8In addition, supply shocks have most frequently come from the volatile food and energy categories and have passed quickly.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: While food and energy prices critically affect the budgets of households and businesses, the policy tools of central banks work more slowly than commodity markets move.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Responding aggressively to quickly passing price increases could exacerbate macroeconomic volatility without supporting price stability.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Our experience since 2020 highlights some limits of that thinking.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: To begin with, it can be challenging to disentangle supply shocks from demand shocks in real time, and also to determine how long either will persist, particularly in the extraordinary circumstances of the past three years.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Supply shocks that have a persistent effect on potential output could call for restrictive policy to better align aggregate demand with the suppressed level of aggregate supply.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The sequence of shocks to global supply chains experienced from 2020 to 2022 suppressed output for a considerable time and may have persistently altered global supply dynamics.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Such a sequence calls on policymakers to use policy restraint to limit inflationary effects.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Policy restraint in this case is also good risk management.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Supply shocks that drive inflation high enough for long enough can affect the longer-term inflation expectations of households and businesses.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Monetary policy must forthrightly address any risks of a potential de-anchoring of inflation expectations, as well-anchored expectations help facilitate bringing inflation back to our target.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The sharp policy tightening during 2022 likely contributed to keeping inflation expectations well anchored.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: My third question is the level where interest rates will settle once the effects of the pandemic are truly behind us.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: By 2019, the general level of nominal interest rates had declined steadily over several decades (figure 4).

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: As the pandemic arrived, many advanced economies had below-target inflation and low or mildly negative policy rates, raising difficult questions about the efficacy of interest rate policy when constrained by the effective lower bound (ELB).

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Over two decades, an extensive literature had identified a number of possible changes to the widely used inflation-targeting regime, including negative policy rates, nominal income targeting, and various forms of makeup strategies under which persistent shortfalls in inflation would be followed by a period of inflation running moderately above 2 percent.9Today, inflation and policy rates are elevated, and the ELB is not currently relevant for our policy decisions.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: But it is too soon to say whether the monetary policy challenges of the ELB will ultimately turn out to be a thing of the past.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The prolonged proximity of interest rates to the ELB was at the heart of the monetary policy review and the changes we made to our framework in 2020.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We will begin our next five-year review in the latter half of 2024 and announce the results about a year later.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Among the questions we will consider is the degree to which the structural features of the economy that led to low interest rates in the pre-pandemic era will persist.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: With time, we will continue to learn from the experience of the past few years, and what implications it may hold for monetary policy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: These are just three of the many questions raised by these challenging times, and we are far from a complete understanding of the answers.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: I appreciate the opportunity to discuss these issues with you today and look forward to our conversation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you, Stacey, for the chance to be part of this celebration.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: It is great to be here to honor the Division of Research and Statistics (R&S) and humbling to see so many Fed people who served the institution over long and distinguished careers and have returned for this great occasion.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The Fed is one of those places where you can work for a decade or so and still feel like a newbie.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: For those listening outside this room, I will briefly outline R&S's responsibilities.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: A large part of the division, along with other divisions at the Board, is engaged in producing the Tealbook, which contains the staff's forecast for the U.S. economy, as well as a great deal of data and analysis on financial and economic issues, and which is delivered to the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) before our meetings.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Outside of the FOMC meeting cycle, R&S deploys its experts wherever they are needed across the Board, providing crucial inputs to work on financial stability, bank merger analysis, and many other topics.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: R&S is also an ongoing source of specialized information for policymakers.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: If Board members have questions about even the most arcane workings of some aspect of the economy, they can send an email and, in no time, be sitting down with some of the best-informed experts on that subject.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Much of the time, these are R&S economists.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: During the pandemic, when questions arose about how the computer chip shortage was affecting auto production or how businesses were responding to the backlog at U.S. ports, R&S gave detailed briefings on these topics.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Among its other activities, the Board of Governors is one of the world's most productive economic research institutions, and a large share of that work takes place inside R&S, supporting our mission of promoting a healthy economy and a strong and stable financial system.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: I've spoken about research—now let me turn to statistics.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: In addition to the gathering of data from many sources outside the Federal Reserve, R&S is itself the source for some of the most important data on the economy and the financial system.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Our consumer credit data provide financial markets and the public with a vital indicator of the strength of household spending and balance sheets.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Each month, the Industrial Production report gives us insights into how well certain sectors of the economy, especially in the manufacturing realm, are operating.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: R&S is also responsible for the Financial Accounts of the United States, a quarterly compendium of assets, liabilities, and transactions for different segments of the economy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: And every three years, R&S conducts the Survey of Consumer Finances, a premier source of detail and insights about how households are faring in the economy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The latest survey was published just last month.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: These and other data series produced by R&S are a significant public service.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: I want to focus in more detail on the forecast, perhaps the most important of R&S's roles.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The U.S. economy baseline forecast produced by R&S, along with the simulation of a half-dozen plausible alternative paths, constitutes the largest part of the essential bedrock that enables our pursuit of our dual-mandate goals.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Some people are attracted to extremely challenging tasks.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The people of R&S are those people, having chosen such a task in forecasting the path of the U.S. economy, eight times a year for FOMC meetings, with ongoing updates between meetings.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: They do this work on the biggest stage and with the highest stakes, knowing that the economy very often surprises us.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Several qualities are required to do this work well.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: I will start with an intense commitment.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The work requires everything you have to give.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: You have to love this work to do it well.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The job also requires integrity—policymakers count on R&S to give us their best thinking, not shading the results for any reason.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Regular forecasting also demands a systematic approach and a high degree of intellectual rigor.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Ask Stacey and her colleagues to explain a certain aspect of the forecast, and you will find that they have a clear explanation grounded in a rigorous framework.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: That intellectual rigor has to be combined with flexibility and agility.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Economic models can do a reasonably good job of capturing the working of the economy over past decades.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Of course, even with state-of-the-art models and even in relatively calm times, the economy frequently surprises us.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: But our economy is flexible and dynamic, and subject at times to unpredictable shocks, such as a global financial crisis or a pandemic.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: At those times, forecasters have to think outside the models.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: This work also takes large doses of courage and humility.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: To complement this rigorous process, there has to be good judgment, based on knowledge and experience.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Perhaps the most important legacy of the past century for the Division of Research and Statistics is the resilience, the creativity, the energy, the rigor, and the commitment with which R&S has risen to the many challenges it and our country have faced in that span of history.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: On behalf of the Board and the FOMC, thank you for that, and hearty congratulations on your first 100 years of service to the public.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: I am delighted and honored to introduce Professor Alan Blinder as this year's winner of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Prize.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: The Moynihan Prize honors those who "champion the use of informed judgment to advance the public good.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: "1In the field of economics, I can think of no better example of such a champion than Alan Blinder.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: The very heart of his distinguished career has been advancing the use of informed judgment in economic policymaking.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: As Alan has observed, in our political economy, there exist two neighboring tribes, sharing common interests but separated by cultural and language barriers.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: On one side of the border there is the academy, particularly social scientists, who work to assess the costs and benefits of public policies, actual and possible.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: On the other side are the policymakers, including elected officials as well as those who work at various government agencies.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Folks on the academy side generally feel that the policymakers would make better policy if they paid more attention to academic work.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Meanwhile, policymakers often look across that divide desiring that academic work pay more attention to the practical realities of policymaking.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Like Moynihan himself, Alan Blinder is that rare person who both transcends this barrier and recognizes its significance.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: As he made clear to the Senate during his confirmation process to become Vice Chair of the Federal Reserve, "Academic economists are often aloof from practical policy debates; but I have not been.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: "2And he has regularly called on his academic colleagues to "train their powerful tools on real-world issues instead of chasing intellectual will-o'-the-wisps.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Alan's academic work is a testimony to those principles.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: He has used the powerful tools of economics to address the critical policy topics of our time.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: From his pathbreaking work on the great stagflation of the 1970s,4through his analysis of central bank structure, independence, and communications,5to his research on financial crises6and his masterful summary of the past 60 years of monetary and fiscal policy,7Alan's work is always policy relevant, rigorous, and crystal clear.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Alan has also been a top monetary policymaker, in addition to advising Presidents, Fed Chairs and numerous other officials on both a formal and informal basis.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: But his work goes beyond his excellence as a member of both the academic and policymaker tribes.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Alan's life's work has featured a continuous effort to foster greater understanding and communication across the divide.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: To illustrate this, I will close with two broad categories of engagement that have been hallmarks of Alan's career.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: The first is Alan's work addressing the academy–policy divide itself.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Two of his books, published 30 years apart, show his career-long focus answering this question: How can social science, and particularly economics, support good public policies?

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: First inHard Heads, Soft Hearts,he articulates the problems these groups have in communicating and working with each other.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: He provides guidance and examples of success and failure while advocating an economic philosophy that combines "profound respect for the virtues of free markets with profound concern for those the market leaves behind.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: "8He restated that philosophy more recently inAdvice and Dissent,in which he catalogs his own experience trying to bridge that gap, outlines what that experience has taught him, and gives additional direction "toward more useful economic advice met by less political dissent.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: The second category is Alan's engagement with the broader American public.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: He is the rare public figure who speaks fluently in both English and "Economics," and both audiences rightly consider him a native speaker.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: A natural teacher, Alan has communicated clearly and accessibly over the years with a wide range of audiences, bringing to bear facts, insights and lessons from history and policymaking.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: His countless newspaper columns, broadcast interviews and many books do more than clearly explain the economic issues of the day.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Through them, Alan has managed to make economics both fascinating and essential to an extraordinarily wide audience.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: That is doubtless due in part to his habit of serving up the substance with a healthy dose of humor.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Whether it is an academic article on the economics of brushing teeth,10a dinner talk outlining critical issues for central bankers with the help of Gilbert and Sullivan,11or the general wit on display in any of his regular columns, Alan's style enlivens even the most technical and dry topics.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Moynihan surely would have approved.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: Over the span of four decades, and counting, for many policymakers from different sectors of the political forest, and for me personally, Alan Blinder has been a friend, a source of good advice, a supporter, an insightful critic, a role model, and a wise soul.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: His published writings as an academic economist are essential to our work, and beyond count.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: The same is true of the friendships he has forged.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: He embodies so much of what many policymakers aspire to in his commitment to hard-headed analysis, tempered by a soft heart, that supports good public policy that benefits all Americans.

title: Introductory Remarks
sentence_text: I am delighted and honored to introduce Professor Alan Blinder of Princeton University, this year's winner of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Prize.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Before our discussion, I will take a few minutes to discuss recent economic data and the outlook for monetary policy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Recent Economic DataIncoming data over recent months show ongoing progress toward both of our dual mandate goals—maximum employment and stable prices.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: InflationBy the time the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) raised rates in March 2022, it was clear that restoring price stability would require both the unwinding of pandemic-related distortions to supply and demand, and also restrictive monetary policy to cool strong demand and give supply time to catch up.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: These forces are now working together to bring inflation down.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: After peaking at 7.1 percent in June 2022, 12-month headline PCE (personal consumption expenditure) inflation is estimated at 3.5 percent through September.1Core PCE inflation, which omits the volatile food and energy components, provides a better indicator of where inflation is heading.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Twelve-month core PCE inflation peaked at 5.6 percent in February 2022 and is estimated at 3.7 percent through September.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Inflation readings turned lower over the summer, a very favorable development.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The September inflation data continued the downward trend but were somewhat less encouraging.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Shorter-term measures of core inflation over the most recent three and six months are now running below 3 percent.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: But these shorter-term measures are often volatile.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: In any case, inflation is still too high, and a few months of good data are only the beginning of what it will take to build confidence that inflation is moving down sustainably toward our goal.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We cannot yet know how long these lower readings will persist, or where inflation will settle over coming quarters.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: While the path is likely to be bumpy and take some time, my colleagues and I are united in our commitment to bringing inflation down sustainably to 2 percent.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The labor marketIn the labor market, strong job creation has met a welcome increase in the supply of workers, due to both higher participation and a rebound of immigration to pre-pandemic levels.2Many indicators suggest that, while conditions remain tight, the labor market is gradually cooling.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Job openings have moved well down from their highs and are now only modestly above pre-pandemic levels.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Quits are back to pre-pandemic levels, and the same is true of the wage premium earned by those who change jobs.3Surveys of workers and employers show a return to pre-pandemic levels of tightness.4And indicators of wage growth show a gradual decline toward levels that would be consistent with 2 percent inflation over time.5

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: GrowthTo date, declining inflation has not come at the cost of meaningfully higher unemployment—a highly welcome development, but a historically unusual one.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Healing of supply chains in conjunction with the rebalancing of demand and supply in the labor market has allowed disinflation without substantially weaker economic activity.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Indeed, economic growth has consistently surprised to the upside this year, as most recently seen in the strong retail sales data released earlier this week.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Forecasters generally expect gross domestic product to come in very strong for the third quarter before cooling off in the fourth quarter and next year.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Still, the record suggests that a sustainable return to our 2 percent inflation goal is likely to require a period of below-trend growth and some further softening in labor market conditions.6

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Geopolitical tensions are highly elevated and pose important risks to global economic activity.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Our institutional role at the Federal Reserve is to monitor these developments for their economic implications, which remain highly uncertain.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Speaking for myself, I found the attack on Israel horrifying, as is the prospect for more loss of innocent lives.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Monetary PolicyTurning to monetary policy, the FOMC has tightened policy substantially over the past 18 months, increasing the federal funds rate by 525 basis points at a historically fast pace and decreasing our securities holdings by roughly $1 trillion.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: The stance of policy is restrictive, meaning that tight policy is putting downward pressure on economic activity and inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Given the fast pace of the tightening, there may still be meaningful tightening in the pipeline.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: My colleagues and I are committed to achieving a stance of policy that is sufficiently restrictive to bring inflation sustainably down to 2 percent over time, and to keeping policy restrictive until we are confident that inflation is on a path to that objective.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We are attentive to recent data showing the resilience of economic growth and demand for labor.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Additional evidence of persistently above-trend growth, or that tightness in the labor market is no longer easing, could put further progress on inflation at risk and could warrant further tightening of monetary policy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Along with many other factors, actual and expected changes in the stance of monetary policy affect broader financial conditions, which in turn affect economic activity, employment and inflation.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Financial conditions have tightened significantly in recent months, and longer-term bond yields have been an important driving factor in this tightening.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We remain attentive to these developments because persistent changes in financial conditions can have implications for the path of monetary policy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: ConclusionMy colleagues and I remain resolute in our commitment to returning inflation to 2 percent over time.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: A range of uncertainties, both old and new, complicate our task of balancing the risk of tightening monetary policy too much against the risk of tightening too little.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Doing too little could allow above-target inflation to become entrenched and ultimately require monetary policy to wring more persistent inflation from the economy at a high cost to employment.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Doing too much could also do unnecessary harm to the economy.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: Given the uncertainties and risks, and how far we have come, the Committee is proceeding carefully.

title: Opening Remarks
sentence_text: We will make decisions about the extent of additional policy firming and how long policy will remain restrictive based on the totality of the incoming data, the evolving outlook, and the balance of risks.
