title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you, Sarah, thank you to those in Fed Education who helped put together this event, and thank you to the teachers here and online who have put aside some of their planning time to listen and, I hope, also participate.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: If I were doing the grading, credit would always be granted for participation.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: We have scheduled this discussion with teachers well into the school year, partly to highlight the beginning, on October 1, of Economic Education Month.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: At the Fed, every month is Economic Education Month, and we are glad to join in the celebration.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: It is, fortunately, a very different time for teachers than the one we faced in August 2021, the last time we held this discussion with educators.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: In the crisis of the pandemic, teachers were on the front lines.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I know how overwhelming this challenge was for many of you, and the extent of your sacrifice, for which I thank you.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: And the crisis in many ways continues, as research confirms the educational deficits that students still suffer from the pandemic.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: In addition to the challenges they face, there are likely to be consequences for the economy and for society, in a generation of young people who may lack some of what they need to be well-informed and engaged participants in our economy and our democracy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Addressing this legacy of the pandemic is a major public policy challenge, so now more than ever, teachers are crucial to America's future.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: A large majority of you are economic educators, a role that is of particular importance.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: As many of you know, the Fed's ability to influence the economy depends to some extent on influencing the public's view of current and future economic conditions.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: When my colleagues and I publish our projections for the most likely path for the economy and interest rates, as we did a couple of weeks ago, one of our goals is to influence spending and investment decisions today and in the months ahead.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: That will only be the case if people understand what we are saying and what it means for their own finances.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: That's where you come in.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: By educating students about economics, not only are you providing them with valuable skills to manage their finances, and to improve their chances for future success in any number of occupations that draw on economic thinking.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: You are also giving them the knowledge that they need to understand the macroeconomy, including the implications of decisions that the Fed makes.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Economic educators impart knowledge that is instrumental in how the Federal Reserve promotes a healthy economy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: In a way, when you are teaching students, you are also conducting monetary policy.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: But you do a lot more than that.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Teachers illuminate the world for us.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: They help us to see the limitless possibilities in life, and as much as that, also in ourselves.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: At a wonderful but also very vulnerable time in each of our lives, teachers like you are there to help us understand the world, especially when it is hard to understand.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I will leave you with one of the many examples I could cite from my time in school.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I can clearly recall one November day, in fifth grade, at Blessed Sacrament School here in Washington, D.C. My teacher Mrs. Keller was called away from class.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: I adored Mrs. Keller, and when she returned to the room, I think every student was as upset as I was to see her tear-streaked face.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: And then we got the news—President John F. Kennedy had been shot and killed in Dallas.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: This was something that was very hard for my classmates and me to understand, but Mrs. Keller pulled herself together and convinced us that, somehow, everything was going to be all right.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Teachers are there for all of us, when we need your knowledge, your example, your encouragement, and your care.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: Thank you for playing the indispensable role you do in our lives, and in our children's lives.

title: Welcoming Remarks
sentence_text: And now, I would be very happy to respond to your questions.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: At last year's Jackson Hole symposium, I delivered a brief, direct message.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: My remarks this year will be a bit longer, but the message is the same: It is the Fed's job to bring inflation down to our 2 percent goal, and we will do so.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We have tightened policy significantly over the past year.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Although inflation has moved down from its peak—a welcome development—it remains too high.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We are prepared to raise rates further if appropriate, and intend to hold policy at a restrictive level until we are confident that inflation is moving sustainably down toward our objective.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Today I will review our progress so far and discuss the outlook and the uncertainties we face as we pursue our dual mandate goals.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: I will conclude with a summary of what this means for policy.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Given how far we have come, at upcoming meetings we are in a position to proceed carefully as we assess the incoming data and the evolving outlook and risks.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The Decline in Inflation So FarThe ongoing episode of high inflation initially emerged from a collision between very strong demand and pandemic-constrained supply.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: By the time the Federal Open Market Committee raised the policy rate in March 2022, it was clear that bringing down inflation would depend on both the unwinding of the unprecedented pandemic-related demand and supply distortions and on our tightening of monetary policy, which would slow the growth of aggregate demand, allowing supply time to catch up.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: While these two forces are now working together to bring down inflation, the process still has a long way to go, even with the more favorable recent readings.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: On a 12-month basis, U.S. total, or "headline," PCE (personal consumption expenditures) inflation peaked at 7 percent in June 2022 and declined to 3.3 percent as of July, following a trajectory roughly in line with global trends (figure 1, panel A).1The effects of Russia's war against Ukraine have been a primary driver of the changes in headline inflation around the world since early 2022.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Headline inflation is what households and businesses experience most directly, so this decline is very good news.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: But food and energy prices are influenced by global factors that remain volatile, and can provide a misleading signal of where inflation is headed.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: In my remaining comments, I will focus on core PCE inflation, which omits the food and energy components.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: On a 12-month basis, core PCE inflation peaked at 5.4 percent in February 2022 and declined gradually to 4.3 percent in July (figure 1, panel B).

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The lower monthly readings for core inflation in June and July were welcome, but two months of good data are only the beginning of what it will take to build confidence that inflation is moving down sustainably toward our goal.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We can't yet know the extent to which these lower readings will continue or where underlying inflation will settle over coming quarters.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Twelve-month core inflation is still elevated, and there is substantial further ground to cover to get back to price stability.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: To understand the factors that will likely drive further progress, it is useful to separately examine the three broad components of core PCE inflation—inflation for goods, for housing services, and for all other services, sometimes referred to as nonhousing services (figure 2).

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Core goods inflation has fallen sharply, particularly for durable goods, as both tighter monetary policy and the slow unwinding of supply and demand dislocations are bringing it down.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The motor vehicle sector provides a good illustration.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Earlier in the pandemic, demand for vehicles rose sharply, supported by low interest rates, fiscal transfers, curtailed spending on in-person services, and shifts in preference away from using public transportation and from living in cities.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: But because of a shortage of semiconductors, vehicle supply actually fell.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Vehicle prices spiked, and a large pool of pent-up demand emerged.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: As the pandemic and its effects have waned, production and inventories have grown, and supply has improved.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: At the same time, higher interest rates have weighed on demand.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Interest rates on auto loans have nearly doubled since early last year, and customers report feeling the effect of higher rates on affordability.2On net, motor vehicle inflation has declined sharply because of the combined effects of these supply and demand factors.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Similar dynamics are playing out for core goods inflation overall.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: As they do, the effects of monetary restraint should show through more fully over time.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Core goods prices fell the past two months, but on a 12-month basis, core goods inflation remains well above its pre-pandemic level.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Sustained progress is needed, and restrictive monetary policy is called for to achieve that progress.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: In the highly interest-sensitive housing sector, the effects of monetary policy became apparent soon after liftoff.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Mortgage rates doubled over the course of 2022, causing housing starts and sales to fall and house price growth to plummet.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Growth in market rents soon peaked and then steadily declined (figure 3).3

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Measured housing services inflation lagged these changes, as is typical, but has recently begun to fall.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: This inflation metric reflects rents paid by all tenants, as well as estimates of the equivalent rents that could be earned from homes that are owner occupied.4Because leases turn over slowly, it takes time for a decline in market rent growth to work its way into the overall inflation measure.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The market rent slowdown has only recently begun to show through to that measure.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The slowing growth in rents for new leases over roughly the past year can be thought of as "in the pipeline" and will affect measured housing services inflation over the coming year.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Going forward, if market rent growth settles near pre-pandemic levels, housing services inflation should decline toward its pre-pandemic level as well.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We will continue to watch the market rent data closely for a signal of the upside and downside risks to housing services inflation.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The final category, nonhousing services, accounts for over half of the core PCE index and includes a broad range of services, such as health care, food services, transportation, and accommodations.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Twelve-month inflation in this sector has moved sideways since liftoff.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Inflation measured over the past three and six months has declined, however, which is encouraging.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Part of the reason for the modest decline of nonhousing services inflation so far is that many of these services were less affected by global supply chain bottlenecks and are generally thought to be less interest sensitive than other sectors such as housing or durable goods.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Production of these services is also relatively labor intensive, and the labor market remains tight.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Given the size of this sector, some further progress here will be essential to restoring price stability.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Over time, restrictive monetary policy will help bring aggregate supply and demand back into better balance, reducing inflationary pressures in this key sector.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The OutlookTurning to the outlook, although further unwinding of pandemic-related distortions should continue to put some downward pressure on inflation, restrictive monetary policy will likely play an increasingly important role.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Getting inflation sustainably back down to 2 percent is expected to require a period of below-trend economic growth as well as some softening in labor market conditions.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Economic growthRestrictive monetary policy has tightened financial conditions, supporting the expectation of below-trend growth.5Since last year's symposium, the two-year real yield is up about 250 basis points, and longer-term real yields are higher as well—by nearly 150 basis points.6Beyond changes in interest rates, bank lending standards have tightened, and loan growth has slowed sharply.7Such a tightening of broad financial conditions typically contributes to a slowing in the growth of economic activity, and there is evidence of that in this cycle as well.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: For example, growth in industrial production has slowed, and the amount spent on residential investment has declined in each of the past five quarters (figure 4).

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: But we are attentive to signs that the economy may not be cooling as expected.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: So far this year, GDP (gross domestic product) growth has come in above expectations and above its longer-run trend, and recent readings on consumer spending have been especially robust.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: In addition, after decelerating sharply over the past 18 months, the housing sector is showing signs of picking back up.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Additional evidence of persistently above-trend growth could put further progress on inflation at risk and could warrant further tightening of monetary policy.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The labor marketThe rebalancing of the labor market has continued over the past year but remains incomplete.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Labor supply has improved, driven by stronger participation among workers aged 25 to 54 and by an increase in immigration back toward pre-pandemic levels.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Indeed, the labor force participation rate of women in their prime working years reached an all-time high in June.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Demand for labor has moderated as well.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Job openings remain high but are trending lower.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Payroll job growth has slowed significantly.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Total hours worked has been flat over the past six months, and the average workweek has declined to the lower end of its pre-pandemic range, reflecting a gradual normalization in labor market conditions (figure 5).

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: This rebalancing has eased wage pressures.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Wage growth across a range of measures continues to slow, albeit gradually (figure 6).

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: While nominal wage growth must ultimately slow to a rate that is consistent with 2 percent inflation, what matters for households is real wage growth.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Even as nominal wage growth has slowed, real wage growth has been increasing as inflation has fallen.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We expect this labor market rebalancing to continue.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Evidence that the tightness in the labor market is no longer easing could also call for a monetary policy response.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Uncertainty and Risk Management along the Path ForwardTwo percent is and will remain our inflation target.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We are committed to achieving and sustaining a stance of monetary policy that is sufficiently restrictive to bring inflation down to that level over time.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: It is challenging, of course, to know in real time when such a stance has been achieved.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: There are some challenges that are common to all tightening cycles.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: For example, real interest rates are now positive and well above mainstream estimates of the neutral policy rate.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We see the current stance of policy as restrictive, putting downward pressure on economic activity, hiring, and inflation.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: But we cannot identify with certainty the neutral rate of interest, and thus there is always uncertainty about the precise level of monetary policy restraint.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: That assessment is further complicated by uncertainty about the duration of the lags with which monetary tightening affects economic activity and especially inflation.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Since the symposium a year ago, the Committee has raised the policy rate by 300 basis points, including 100 basis points over the past seven months.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: And we have substantially reduced the size of our securities holdings.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: The wide range of estimates of these lags suggests that there may be significant further drag in the pipeline.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Beyond these traditional sources of policy uncertainty, the supply and demand dislocations unique to this cycle raise further complications through their effects on inflation and labor market dynamics.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: For example, so far, job openings have declined substantially without increasing unemployment—a highly welcome but historically unusual result that appears to reflect large excess demand for labor.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: In addition, there is evidence that inflation has become more responsive to labor market tightness than was the case in recent decades.8These changing dynamics may or may not persist, and this uncertainty underscores the need for agile policymaking.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: These uncertainties, both old and new, complicate our task of balancing the risk of tightening monetary policy too much against the risk of tightening too little.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Doing too little could allow above-target inflation to become entrenched and ultimately require monetary policy to wring more persistent inflation from the economy at a high cost to employment.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Doing too much could also do unnecessary harm to the economy.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: ConclusionAs is often the case, we are navigating by the stars under cloudy skies.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: In such circumstances, risk-management considerations are critical.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: At upcoming meetings, we will assess our progress based on the totality of the data and the evolving outlook and risks.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Based on this assessment, we will proceed carefully as we decide whether to tighten further or, instead, to hold the policy rate constant and await further data.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: Restoring price stability is essential to achieving both sides of our dual mandate.

title: Inflation:  Progress and the Path Ahead
sentence_text: We will need price stability to achieve a sustained period of strong labor market conditions that benefit all.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Today I will briefly discuss the current economic situation and the stresses that emerged in the U.S. banking system earlier this year.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: I will then turn to the evolution of the financial system since the Great Recession and conclude with a few general observations.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: I will highlight how global efforts to boost resilience in the financial sector over the past decade have been an important success.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: I will also discuss how recent developments have revealed residual vulnerabilities that we are going to address, and the need to be vigilant for emerging risks.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: U.S. economic growth slowed significantly last year, and recent indicators suggest that economic activity has continued to expand at a modest pace.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Growth in consumer spending has picked up this year, and some indicators in the housing market have turned up recently.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: At the same time, activity in the housing sector remains far below its peak in early 2022, reflecting the effects of higher mortgage rates.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Higher interest rates and slower output growth also appear to be weighing on business fixed investment.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The labor market remains very tight.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Over the past three months, payroll job gains have been robust.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The unemployment rate has moved up but remains low.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: There are some signs that supply and demand in the labor market are coming into better balance, including higher labor force participation, some easing in nominal wage growth, and declining vacancies.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: While the jobs-to-workers gap has declined, labor demand still substantially exceeds the supply of available workers.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Inflation, however, remains well above our longer-run goal of 2 percent.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Over the 12 months ending in May, total personal consumption expenditures (PCE) prices are estimated to have risen 3.9 percent; excluding the volatile food and energy categories, core PCE prices likely rose 4.7 percent.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Inflation has moderated somewhat since the middle of last year.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Nonetheless, inflation pressures continue to run high, and the process of getting inflation back down to 2 percent has a long way to go.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Since early last year, we have raised our policy rate by 5 percentage points.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We see the effects of our policy tightening on demand in the most interest rate–sensitive sectors of the economy, particularly housing and investment.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: It will take time, however, for the full effects of monetary restraint to be realized, especially on inflation.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The economy is also facing headwinds from tighter credit conditions for households and businesses, which are likely to weigh on economic activity, hiring, and inflation.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Tighter credit conditions are a natural result of tighter monetary policy.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: But the bank stresses that emerged in March may well lead to a further tightening in credit conditions.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The extent of these effects remains uncertain.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: At our last meeting, the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) decided to maintain the target range for the federal funds rate at 5 to 5-1/4 percent while continuing the process of significantly reducing our securities holdings.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We made this decision in light of the distance we have come in tightening policy, the uncertain lags in monetary policy, and the potential headwinds from credit tightening.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: As noted in the FOMC's Summary of Economic Projections, a strong majority of Committee participants expect that it will be appropriate to raise interest rates two or more times by the end of the year.1

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: When bank stress emerged in March, we acted in concert with other government agencies to address it, enabling the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation to resolve two failed banks in a manner that protected all depositors.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We also used our liquidity tools to make funding available to banks that might need it.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: In addition to our discount window, we established a new facility under our emergency lending authorities, the Bank Term Funding Program.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Our provision of liquidity through these tools supported the stability of the financial system without restricting the use of our monetary policy tools to firm the stance of policy as part of our efforts to reduce inflation.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The banking system remains sound and resilient, deposit flows have stabilized, and strains have eased.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Evolution of the System since the Great RecessionA little more than a decade ago, the Global Financial Crisis required extraordinary interventions by governments around the world.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Stabilizing the U.S. financial system required coordinated efforts by all parts of the government, including $700 billion in taxpayer funds to recapitalize banks, a suite of Fed emergency liquidity facilities, as well as government guarantees on bank transaction accounts and money market mutual funds.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Despite these efforts, the Great Recession brought misery to countless millions.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: As the crisis slowly receded, authorities in the U.S. and around the world implemented a host of reforms.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The goal was to build a system that could withstand severe shocks, including unanticipated ones that might arrive from any direction.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: In other words, a financial system that would be a source of strength during stressful periods.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: A key pillar was building resilience in the banking system.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: This effort was remarkably successful.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Over the course of the decade, capital and liquidity at the largest U.S. banks more than doubled.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We began a program of rigorous annual stress tests to ensure the banking system was capitalized against severe recessions and financial market turmoil.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The Great Recession also underscored the critical importance of the nonbank sector.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Here, too, the authorities have undertaken a number of steps to build resilience, although much remains to be done.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: In 2020 the financial system was again tested, facing a truly unprecedented shock as the pandemic brought the global economy to a standstill.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Investors scrambled for safety and liquidity during the "dash for cash."

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Financial markets came under extreme pressure.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Ultimately, the authorities had to support financial markets again as part of the extremely forceful monetary and fiscal response to the public health emergency.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The banking system, however, was now far more resilient than it had been before the reforms and thus well positioned to absorb the shock.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We cannot take the resilience of the financial system for granted, however.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The multiple shocks we have seen over the past year or so—including the extreme volatility in commodity markets following Russia's invasion of Ukraine and, of course, surprisingly high and persistent inflation as well as the associated increase in interest rates—stressed a range of bank and nonbank financial institutions.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Three General Observations Stemming from the Recent Banking TurmoilGiven the efforts to build resilience in the banking system over the past decade and a half, two natural questions are, why did Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and two other sizable U.S. banks fail this spring, and why did Credit Suisse—a global systemically important bank (G-SIB)—require a government-supported rescue acquisition?

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We are committed to learning the lessons from the U.S. bank failures for our program of supervision and regulation.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: I will offer three observations about the events.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The first observation is that it is very difficult to resist the natural human tendency to fight the last war.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: In 2008 we saw banks come under stress from outsized credit losses and insufficient liquidity.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Such losses appeared possible in the early days of the 2020 crisis, although they ultimately did not materialize.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: In our stress tests, we have considered severe stress scenarios that produced losses on banks' books, including outsized credit losses.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: But, of course, SVB's vulnerability came not from credit risk, but from excessive interest rate risk exposure and a business model that was vulnerable in ways its management did not fully appreciate, including a heavy reliance on uninsured deposits.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: These events suggest a need to strengthen our supervision and regulation of institutions of the size of SVB.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: I look forward to evaluating proposals for such changes and implementing them where appropriate.2Much will depend on getting the specifics right, and we should bear in mind that there are always tradeoffs in any financial regulation.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: In addition, the U.S. has benefited from its rich, multi-tiered banking ecosystem, and that diversity should be preserved.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The second observation is the value of forthrightly recognizing when a crisis is building and responding decisively.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: When SVB failed it was clear that a number of standard assumptions, even though they were informed by hard experience, were wrong.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Notably, bank runs were no longer a matter of days or weeks—they could now be nearly instantaneous.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Fortunately, in concert with other parts of the government, we were able to act decisively to meet the liquidity needs of the banking system, protect depositors, and limit contagion.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The third observation is the value of having the very largest banks be highly resilient.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: Our regulatory system is much stronger for the substantial additional safeguards we have built around the G-SIBs since the Great Recession.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: They are subject to capital surcharges, required to be highly liquid, and held to the highest supervisory standards.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The events of the past couple of months would have been much more difficult to manage had the largest banks been undercapitalized or illiquid.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: ConclusionThe Great Recession was a watershed moment, demonstrating the terrible consequences a fragile financial system can have on people's lives.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: In response, regulators in the U.S. and around the globe set out to build a much more resilient financial system.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: And the ensuing experiences of the pandemic and the past few months did much to validate this approach.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The bank runs and failures in 2023, however, were painful reminders that we cannot predict all of the stresses that will inevitably come with time and chance.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We therefore must not grow complacent about the financial system's resilience.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: And building and maintaining that resilience requires collaboration.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: The system was able to withstand recent shocks because of the efforts by regulators and legislators, including our international counterparts in the globally interconnected financial system.

title: Financial Stability and Economic Developments
sentence_text: We will take these lessons on board, and we will keep learning, as we must, because the work of building and maintaining a resilient financial system is never done.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: I will address three main points.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: First, the Federal Reserve's monetary policy independence is an important and broadly supported institutional arrangement that has served the American public well.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Second, the Fed must continuously earn that independence by using our tools to achieve our assigned goals of maximum employment and price stability, and by providing transparency to facilitate understanding and effective oversight by the public and their elected representatives in Congress.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Third, we should "stick to our knitting" and not wander off to pursue perceived social benefits that are not tightly linked to our statutory goals and authorities.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Central bank independence and transparencyOn the first point, the case for monetary policy independence lies in the benefits of insulating monetary policy decisions from short-term political considerations.1Price stability is the bedrock of a healthy economy and provides the public with immeasurable benefits over time.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: But restoring price stability when inflation is high can require measures that are not popular in the short term as we raise interest rates to slow the economy.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: The absence of direct political control over our decisions allows us to take these necessary measures without considering short-term political factors.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: I believe that the benefits of independent monetary policy in the U.S. context are well understood and broadly accepted.2

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: In a well-functioning democracy, important public policy decisions should be made, in almost all cases, by the elected branches of government.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Grants of independence to agencies should be exceedingly rare, explicit, tightly circumscribed, and limited to those issues that clearly warrant protection from short-term political considerations.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: With independence comes the responsibility to provide the transparency that enables effective oversight by Congress, which, in turn, supports the Fed's democratic legitimacy.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: At the Fed, we treat this as an active, not passive, responsibility, and over the past several decades we have steadily broadened our efforts to provide meaningful transparency about the basis for, and consequences of, the decisions we make in service to the American public.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: We are tightly focused on achieving our statutory mandate and on providing useful and appropriate transparency.3

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Sticking to our mandateIt is essential that we stick to our statutory goals and authorities, and that we resist the temptation to broaden our scope to address other important social issues of the day.4Taking on new goals, however worthy, without a clear statutory mandate would undermine the case for our independence.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: In the area of bank regulation, too, the Fed has a degree of independence, as do the other federal bank regulators.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Independence in this area helps ensure that the public can be confident that our supervisory decisions are not influenced by political considerations.5Today, some analysts ask whether incorporating into bank supervision the perceived risks associated with climate change is appropriate, wise, and consistent with our existing mandates.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Addressing climate change seems likely to require policies that would have significant distributional and other effects on companies, industries, regions, and nations.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: Decisions about policies to directly address climate change should be made by the elected branches of government and thus reflect the public's will as expressed through elections.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: At the same time, in my view, the Fed does have narrow, but important, responsibilities regarding climate-related financial risks.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: These responsibilities are tightly linked to our responsibilities for bank supervision.6The public reasonably expects supervisors to require that banks understand, and appropriately manage, their material risks, including the financial risks of climate change.

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: But without explicit congressional legislation, it would be inappropriate for us to use our monetary policy or supervisory tools to promote a greener economy or to achieve other climate-based goals.7We are not, and will not be, a "climate policymaker."

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"
sentence_text: ReferencesAlesina, Alberto, and Lawrence H. Summers (1993).

title: Panel on "Central Bank Independence and the Mandate—Evolving Views"

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Thank you to the World Affairs Council, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas, and the Dallas Regional Chamber for the kind invitation to be with you today.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: I will start with some brief comments on the economy and monetary policy.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Looking back, the U.S. economy has weathered a global pandemic and its aftermath and is now back to a good place.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The economy has made significant progress toward our dual-mandate goals of maximum employment and stable prices.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The labor market remains in solid condition.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Inflation has eased substantially from its peak, and we believe it is on a sustainable path to our 2 percent goal.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We are committed to maintaining our economy's strength by returning inflation to our goal while supporting maximum employment.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Recent Economic DataEconomic growthThe recent performance of our economy has been remarkably good, by far the best of any major economy in the world.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Economic output grew by more than 3 percent last year and is expanding at a stout 2.5 percent rate so far this year.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Growth in consumer spending has remained strong, supported by increases in disposable income and solid household balance sheets.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Business investment in equipment and intangibles has accelerated over the past year.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: In contrast, activity in the housing sector has been weak.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Improving supply conditions have supported this strong performance of the economy.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The labor force has expanded rapidly, and productivity has grown faster over the past five years than its pace in the two decades before the pandemic, increasing the productive capacity of the economy and allowing rapid economic growth without overheating.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The labor marketThe labor market remains in solid condition, having cooled off from the significantly overheated conditions of a couple of years ago, and is now by many metrics back to more normal levels that are consistent with our employment mandate.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The number of job openings is now just slightly above the number of unemployed Americans seeking work.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The rate at which workers quit their jobs is below the pre-pandemic pace, after touching historic highs two years ago.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Wages are still increasing, but at a more sustainable pace.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Hiring has slowed from earlier in the year.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The most recent jobs report for October reflected significant effects from hurricanes and labor strikes, making it difficult to get a clear signal.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Finally, at 4.1 percent, the unemployment rate is notably higher than a year ago but has flattened out in recent months and remains historically low.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: InflationThe labor market has cooled to the point where it is no longer a source of significant inflationary pressures.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: This cooling and the substantial improvement in broader supply conditions have brought inflation down significantly over the past two years from its mid-2022 peak above 7 percent.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Progress on inflation has been broad based.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Estimates based on the consumer price index and other data released this week indicate that total PCE prices rose 2.3 percent over the 12 months ending in October and that, excluding the volatile food and energy categories, core PCE prices rose 2.8 percent.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Core measures of goods and services inflation, excluding housing, fell rapidly over the past two years and have returned to rates closer to those consistent with our goals.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We expect that these rates will continue to fluctuate in their recent ranges.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We are watching carefully to be sure that they do, however, just as we are closely tracking the gradual decline in housing services inflation, which has yet to fully normalize.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Inflation is running much closer to our 2 percent longer-run goal, but it is not there yet.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We are committed to finishing the job.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: With labor market conditions in rough balance and inflation expectations well anchored, I expect inflation to continue to come down toward our 2 percent objective, albeit on a sometimes-bumpy path.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Monetary PolicyGiven progress toward our inflation goal and the cooling of labor market conditions, last week my Federal Open Market Committee colleagues and I took another step in reducing the degree of policy restraint by lowering our policy interest rate 1/4 percentage point.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We are confident that with an appropriate recalibration of our policy stance, strength in the economy and the labor market can be maintained, with inflation moving sustainably down to 2 percent.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We see the risks to achieving our employment and inflation goals as being roughly in balance, and we are attentive to the risks to both sides.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We know that reducing policy restraint too quickly could hinder progress on inflation.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: At the same time, reducing policy restraint too slowly could unduly weaken economic activity and employment.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We are moving policy over time to a more neutral setting.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: But the path for getting there is not preset.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: In considering additional adjustments to the target range for the federal funds rate, we will carefully assess incoming data, the evolving outlook, and the balance of risks.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The economy is not sending any signals that we need to be in a hurry to lower rates.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The strength we are currently seeing in the economy gives us the ability to approach our decisions carefully.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Ultimately, the path of the policy rate will depend on how the incoming data and the economic outlook evolve.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We remain resolute in our commitment to the dual mandate given to us by Congress: maximum employment and price stability.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Our aim has been to return inflation to our objective without the kind of painful rise in unemployment that has often accompanied past efforts to bring down high inflation.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: That would be a highly desirable result for the communities, families, and businesses we serve.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: While the task is not complete, we have made a good deal of progress toward that outcome.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: I have some brief comments on the economy and monetary policy and look forward to our discussion.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Our economy is strong overall and has made significant progress over the past two years toward achieving our dual-mandate goals of maximum employment and stable prices.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Labor market conditions are solid, having cooled from their previously overheated state.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Inflation has eased, and my Federal Open Market Committee colleagues and I have greater confidence that it is on a sustainable path to 2 percent.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: At our meeting earlier this month, we reduced the level of policy restraint by lowering the target range of the federal funds rate by 1/2 percentage point.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: That decision reflects our growing confidence that, with an appropriate recalibration of our policy stance, strength in the labor market can be maintained in an environment of moderate economic growth and inflation moving sustainably down to our objective.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Recent Economic DataThe labor marketMany indicators show the labor market is solid.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: To mention just a few, the unemployment rate is well within the range of estimates of its natural rate.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The labor force participation rate of individuals aged 25 to 54 (so-called prime age) is near its historic high, and the prime-age women's participation rate has continued to reach new all-time highs.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Real wages are increasing at a solid pace, broadly in line with gains in productivity.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The ratio of job openings to unemployed workers has moved down steadily but remains just above 1—so that there are still more open positions than there are people seeking work.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Prior to 2019, that was rarely the case.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Still, labor market conditions have clearly cooled over the past year.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Workers now view jobs as somewhat less available than they were in 2019.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The moderation in job growth and the increase in labor supply have led the unemployment rate to increase to 4.2 percent, still low by historical standards.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We do not believe that we need to see further cooling in labor market conditions to achieve 2 percent inflation.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: InflationOver the most recent 12 months, headline and core inflation were 2.2 percent and 2.7 percent, respectively.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Disinflation has been broad based, and recent data indicate further progress toward a sustained return to 2 percent.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Core goods prices have fallen 0.5 percent over the past year, close to their pre-pandemic pace, as supply bottlenecks have eased.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Outside of housing, core services inflation is also close to its pre-pandemic pace.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Housing services inflation continues to decline, but sluggishly.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The growth rate in rents charged to new tenants remains low.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: As long as that remains the case, housing services inflation will continue to decline.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Broader economic conditions also set the table for further disinflation.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The labor market is now roughly in balance.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Longer-run inflation expectations remain well anchored.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Monetary PolicyOver the past year, we have continued to see solid growth and healthy gains in the labor force and productivity.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Our goal all along has been to restore price stability without the kind of painful rise in unemployment that has frequently accompanied efforts to bring down high inflation.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: That would be a highly desirable result for the communities, families, and businesses we serve.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: While the task is not complete, we have made a good deal of progress toward that outcome.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: For much of the past three years, inflation ran well above our goal, and the labor market was extremely tight.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Appropriately, our focus was on bringing down inflation.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: By keeping monetary policy restrictive, we helped restore the balance between overall supply and demand in the economy.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: That patient approach has paid dividends: Inflation is now much closer to our 2 percent objective.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Today, we see the risks to achieving our employment and inflation goals as roughly in balance.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Our policy rate had been at a two-decade high since the July 2023 meeting.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: At the time of that meeting, core inflation was above 4 percent, well above our target, and unemployment was 3.5 percent, near a 50-year low.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: In the 14 months since, inflation has moved down, and unemployment has moved up, in both cases significantly.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: It was time for a recalibration of our policy stance to reflect progress toward our goals as well as the changed balance of risks.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: As I mentioned, our decision to reduce our policy rate by 50 basis points reflects our growing confidence that, with an appropriate recalibration of our policy stance, strength in the labor market can be maintained in a context of moderate economic growth and inflation moving sustainably down to 2 percent.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Looking forward, if the economy evolves broadly as expected, policy will move over time toward a more neutral stance.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: But we are not on any preset course.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: The risks are two-sided, and we will continue to make our decisions meeting by meeting.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: As we consider additional policy adjustments, we will carefully assess incoming data, the evolving outlook, and the balance of risks.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Overall, the economy is in solid shape; we intend to use our tools to keep it there.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: We remain resolute in our commitment to our maximum-employment and price-stability mandates.

title: Economic Outlook
sentence_text: Everything we do is in service to our public mission.
